title: Part-Time Customer Service & Community Support Specialist (With Scope to Grow)
description:
**Part-Time Customer Service & Community Support Specialist (With Scope to Grow)**



We are a growing luxury e-commerce handbag brand specialising in timeless Italian leather handbags.



This is a *part-time position*, with clear scope to grow as the business continues to expand. We are looking for a proactive, detail-driven Customer Service & Community Support Specialist to deliver exceptional, high-touch customer experiences across
, live chat, and social platforms.



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys helping customers, problem-solving, and taking ownership of the customer experience while leveraging modern tools like AI to improve efficiency and consistency across communications.



Because we are a luxury brand, our customers have a high level of expectation. We require someone who communicates with polish, warmth, and professionalism, and who feels confident engaging with a discerning demographic.



*Important:*



* Applicants *must have experience using ChatGPT* (or similar AI tools). We have a trained GPT system that supports customer service communications, and you must be confident working alongside AI tools daily.

* Please do not apply if you do not have hands-on experience using *Shopify*.



---



*Key Responsibilities*



* Responding to customer service
s regarding order tracking, shipping timelines, delivery issues, product enquiries, refunds, and exchanges

* Processing refunds accurately and efficiently

* Creating and managing return labels via eParcel

* Responding to
 and Instagram 

* Managing Shopify live chat and instant replies for on-site customers

* Monitoring and responding to customer reviews in a timely and professional manner

* Monitoring pending orders in Shopify and proactively notifying customers of delays or issues

* Flagging and following up on failed or delayed shipments

* Suggesting improvements to
 templates and FAQs based on recurring enquiries

* Maintaining a consistently high standard of empathy, clarity, and professionalism

* Leveraging AI tools such as ChatGPT to streamline workflows and enhance response quality

* Assisting in refining and improving our AI-powered communication system using brand policies, templates, and operational guidelines



---



*Required Skills & Experience*



* Demonstrated experience using *Shopify*

* Experience using *eParcel* for shipping and return labels

* Experience managing customer communications via
 and Instagram

* Experience responding to and managing customer reviews (Yotpo or similar platforms preferred)

* Strong written communication skills, with the ability to adapt tone for a premium audience

* Proven experience using *ChatGPT or similar AI tools* in a professional setting

* Ability to create, refine, and optimise response templates

* Strong problem-solving skills and confidence handling customer escalations

* High attention to detail and process accuracy



---



*Personal Attributes*



* Self-motivated and confident making independent decisions

* Efficient, organised, and detail-oriented

* Strong customer-first mindset

* Comfortable managing multiple platforms simultaneously

* Tech-savvy with a genuine interest in AI and automation

* Naturally polished communicator who understands elevated brand voice

* Comfortable with regular online check-ins and collaborative workflow



---



*Why Join Us*



* Be part of a growing luxury e-commerce brand

* Directly influence customer experience and brand reputation

* Supportive and collaborative working relationship

* Genuine opportunity for the role to expand as the business grows



If you are experienced in Shopify, confident using ChatGPT, and passionate about delivering premium customer service, we would love to hear from you.

title: Payroll
description:
We’re seeking an experienced **Payroll Officer** with solid **bookkeeping skills** to manage our end?to?end weekly payroll for a workforce of approximately **500 employees**. This is a key role in a fast?paced environment where accuracy, reliability, and confidentiality are essential.



### ???? Key Responsibilities

- Process **weekly payroll for 500 staff**, ensuring accuracy and compliance with awards, EBAs, and statutory requirements.  

- Maintain employee records, timesheets, leave balances, and onboarding/offboarding payroll data.  

- Reconcile payroll reports, superannuation, PAYG, and other statutory obligations.  

- Assist with month?end and year?end payroll reporting, including STP and EOFY finalisation.  

- Support general bookkeeping tasks such as accounts payable/receivable, reconciliations, and data entry.  

- Respond to payroll queries promptly and professionally.



### ???? What You Bring

- Proven experience in **high?volume payroll** (300+ employees preferred; 500+ ideal).  

- Basic Bookkeeping background preferred with excellent attention to detail.  Accounts Receivable and Payable, Bank reconciliation

- Preferably you will have a solid understanding of Australian payroll legislation, awards, and compliance.  

- Proficiency with payroll and accounting software (e.g., MYOB, Xero, Found U).  

- Ability to work to strict deadlines while maintaining accuracy.  

- Strong communication skills and a commitment to confidentiality.



### ???? Why Join Us?

- Stable, supportive team environment.  

- Opportunity to take ownership of a critical business function.  

- Competitive salary based on experience.  

- Ongoing training and professional development.

title: Senior Graphic Designer with Modern Skill with AI Prompting Master Skils and proven experience with Amazon
description:
ABOUT US



Since 2013, Prodigy Media has built more than brands — we've created an Amazon-native empire. With 12 years of proven success and 28+ product lines under our belt, we don't play small. Our mission? Launch culturally resonant, design-led, emotionally sticky products that dominate Amazon and beyond.



Now, we're leveling up — and we want a design assassin who’s mastered AI workflows, commands Midjourney like a wizard, and turns prompts into visual gold.



WHO WE WANT



This is not your average graphic design role. We're looking for a hybrid Creative Director / Prompt Engineer / Graphic Design savant who can:



Think like a marketer. Design like an artist. Prompt like an AI god.



You’ll own the visual storytelling for our brands, using both traditional tools and bleeding-edge AI systems to pump out Amazon-optimized assets that convert.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Craft Ultra-High-Converting Amazon Ads – static, lifestyle, 
-tier, and scroll-stopping. Own A+ Content Design – full module execution with story arcs that build obsession. Design Labels & Packaging – pixel-perfect, regulatory-ready, and unforgettable on the shelf. Prompt, Edit & Produce AI-Generated Visuals – using tools like Midjourney, DALL•E, Runway, Spline, Veo3, Sora, and others. Run 3D Product Renders – via Blender, KeyShot, or AI-powered 3D tools. Develop Scroll-Hook Videos – using After Effects, Premiere, Runway AI, etc.



Systematize Brand Visuals Across 30+ Products – while keeping it all aligned, emotional, and conversion-focused.



WHO YOU ARE



5+ years in design, at least 2+ years in Amazon/e-commerce brand creative

Fluent in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Blender, After Effects

Pro-level Midjourney / AI prompt engineer – this is non-negotiable

Obsessed with Amazon visual psychology, packaging psychology, and design that sells

Able to juggle 10 brands and still hit deadlines

Operate with a Creative Director mindset — not just execution, but strategy

Bonus: Experience creating creative systems, art direction templates, or leading a team



MUST-HAVES

Portfolio with Amazon ads, A+ pages, labels, 3D renders, videos, and AI-gen examples

Real-world use of AI tools integrated into your workflow

Available Mon-Fri 5:00am–2:00pm PST

title: Shopify Theme Designer (Fashion E-commerce)
description:
Shopify Theme Designer (Fashion E-commerce)



Full-Time • Long-Term Position



About Us



We are a fast-growing e-commerce group operating multiple Shopify stores across Europe and the United States.



80% of our stores are fashion-focused.



Our goal this year is ambitious:

We are building and refining premium Shopify themes across 100 stores, designed for scalability, performance, and brand positioning.



We are looking for a full-time Shopify Theme Designer who understands both structure and creativity — someone who can build scalable frameworks while keeping each brand visually unique.



The Opportunity



Opportunity to help build and standardize scalable theme frameworks across 100 stores — while maintaining unique brand identity and creative differentiation for each market.



This is not about copy-paste stores.

It’s about combining system thinking with strong visual direction.



Your Responsibilities



Design and customize premium Shopify themes (mainly fashion)



Work with Shopify Theme Store themes and high-quality 3rd-party themes



Build scalable theme structures that can be reused and adapted



Ensure strong mobile-first UX and clean layout hierarchy



Create visually premium fashion experiences



Deliver 3–5 theme builds per week across EU markets + USA



Adapt themes for multiple countries and languages



Ensure themes are Google Merchant Center compliant



Maintain consistency in structure while allowing creative variation



What We’re Looking For



Proven experience designing Shopify themes



Strong experience in fashion e-commerce (important)



Experience customizing 3rd-party Shopify themes



Understanding of conversion-focused design



Strong eye for spacing, typography, balance, and hierarchy



Ability to work in a structured, high-output environment



Long-term mindset — we are building for scale



You should be comfortable combining:

Systematic thinking + creative execution.



What We Offer



Full-time position



Long-term collaboration



High-volume, stable workflow



Clear internal structure and SOPs



Direct communication with experienced e-commerce operators



Opportunity to contribute to a 100-store scalable ecosystem



To Apply, Please Include:



Fashion Shopify stores you personally designed (live links)



Themes you built or heavily customized



Your availability



Your expected monthly salary



We are looking to hire immediately.

title: QC Project Specialist
description:
Arins Media

QC Project Specialist



DEPARTMENT: Project Coordination / Quality Control

REPORTS TO: Admin Team / CEO

WORK HOURS: Starting at 20+ hours/week with a clear path to full-time

SCHEDULE: Monday through Saturday (Monday half-day, Saturday half-day) — 5:00 AM to 11:00 AM PST (9:00 PM to 3:00 AM PHT)

STARTING PAY: $5–$6 per hour

POTENTIAL SALARY: $1,000–$1,800 / month

DELIVERABLE DEADLINE: All photo deliveries must be completed by 9:00 AM PST (1:00 AM PHT)



Who We Are



Arins Media is a real estate media company that creates high-quality photo, video, 3D tour, and branding content for real estate agents. We’re known for fast turnaround, reliable delivery, and a white-glove experience that makes every client feel heard and taken care of.



We’re a small, close-knit team that genuinely cares — about our clients, about our work, and about each other. We believe in building real relationships, supporting each other’s growth, and creating an environment where your ideas matter and your contributions are valued. If you’re looking for a team that feels like family, where you’ll be supported and can grow into bigger responsibilities over time — we’d love to meet you.



Summary



We’re looking for a detail-obsessed, reliable person to join our team as a QC Project Specialist. Your primary focus will be reviewing and quality-checking photos and listings before they go out to clients, ensuring every deliverable meets our high standards. You’ll also handle light admin tasks and help keep our project workflow running smoothly.



This role starts at 20+ hours per week with a clear path to full-time as we grow together. Photo delivery is time-sensitive — most QC work is completed during evening/night hours in Philippine time (9:00 PM–3:00 AM PHT) to ensure listings go out on time for our US-based clients.



All training will be provided through clear SOPs, checklists, and Loom tutorials. We’re looking for someone who is willing to learn, open to feedback, and excited to be part of a team that’s building something great.



What’s In It For You



• A team that genuinely cares about you and your growth — not just the work you produce

• Clear path from part-time to full-time with increased pay based on your performance and initiative

• Growth potential into a VA Project & Admin Specialist role with expanded responsibilities

• All training provided — we invest in helping you succeed

• Consistent, reliable work with a growing company

• A supportive environment where your ideas for improving how we work are welcomed and valued

Responsibilities



Quality Control

• Review and quality-check all photo deliverables before they are sent to clients

• Ensure photos meet Arins Media’s quality standards using detailed checklists and SOPs

• Make edits and retouches in Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop as needed

• Review video deliverables as assigned (approximately every 3rd–4th listing)

• Upload finalized photos to Spiro for client delivery

• Upload photos to AutoHDR as part of the editing and QC workflow

• Ensure all photo deliveries are completed by 9:00 AM PST (1:00 AM PHT)

• Flag any quality issues and communicate them clearly to the team

Admin Support

• Assist with project coordination tasks as needed

• Help maintain organized files and project records in Dropbox and 

• Communicate with the admin team on delivery statuses and project updates

• Contribute to improving workflows and suggesting more efficient processes

Skills and Qualifications



Required



• Proficient in Adobe Lightroom and Adobe Photoshop — this is essential

• Extreme attention to detail and consistency in your work

• Reliable and dependable — you show up on time and follow through every day

• Able to work efficiently under time-sensitive deadlines

• Willing to learn, adapt to new tools, and take feedback openly

• Comfortable managing several tasks at the same time

• Good written and spoken English for team communication

• Proficient with Google Workspace and general file management

• Proficient in Canva

• Available to work a minimum of 20 hours per week, Monday through Saturday, during evening/night hours PHT



Preferred



• Previous experience as a photo editor or in quality control for real estate media

• Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or CapCut

• Familiarity with CRM platforms (Spiro or similar)

• Experience with Slack or
, 
, Dropbox, and Loom

• Ability to think outside the box and find ways to simplify and improve workflows

• Comfortable speaking English in tea
etings and calls

 

Instructions to Apply



Please follow these instructions carefully. Applications that do not follow the steps below will not be considered.



Please
 
 with a video recording of yourself answering the following questions:



1. Please tell us about yourself — what do you love?

2. Please tell us about your past work experience and how it relates to this job at Arins Media. Why do you believe you would be a great fit for this position?

3. Do you have any leadership or management experience?

4. (Optional, but gives you an advantage) Tell us about your experience with photo editing or quality control. How do you make sure you don’t miss small details when you’re working fast?

Please begin your
 with the phrase “I read the full posting.”



Bonus: In your
, let us know what AI tools you use in your daily work and how you use them.



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Executive Assistant / Project Manager

This role is for someone who thinks in systems, spots gaps before they become problems, stays ahead of deadlines, and keeps the entire team aligned without needing constant supervision. You are here to support leadership, manage projects, and keep systems running smoothly so the rest of the team can focus on execution.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important, and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an exceptional place to work with strong systems, high standards, and real impact, not just managing tasks for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you think in priorities, timelines, and dependencies? Do you enjoy turning scattered ideas into structured plans with clear owners and deadlines? Are you the type who follows up before being asked and catches details others miss? Do you take pride in building clean systems, documenting processes properly, and keeping teams aligned without constant supervision?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Admin & Team Support

- Manage calendars, meetings, follow-ups, and reminders

- Handle inbox organization and message triage

- Prepare documents, trackers, and internal updates

- Keep files, folders, and naming systems clean and consistent



Project Management

- Follow up on deliverables and flag risks early

Systems & Process

- Document SOPs and workflows as things evolve

- Spot inefficiencies and automation opportunities, and suggest, design, and implement improvements

- Maintain dashboards, trackers, and recurring reports



Communication & Coordination

- Act as the bridge between leadership and the team

- Clarify priorities and next steps after meetings

- Ensure instructions are understood and executed correctly

- Keep everyone aligned without micromanaging



REQUIREMENTS:

Experience & Capability

- Must have extensive experience as an executive assistant, chief of staff, or operations associate

- Project management experience and comfortable managing and driving multiple large projects

- Must have previous experience managing people. You may not have any direct reports, but the experience is important

- Must have experience automating workflows and designing workflow processes with automation in mind. You may not be individually responsible for building them, but you should already have the experience to handle basic tasks and understand how the process works

- Comfortable with outcome and goal-based delegation and does not need to be told individual tasks

- Experience with Google Suite and GoHighLevel CRM is a plus, but not required

- Should be fluent in AI, but not reliant on it to think for you



Work Style & Standards

- Extremely detail-oriented

- Excellent organizational skills

- Excellent time management skills

- Strong written communication

- Strong written and spoken English communication skills; near-native level preferred

- Comfortable juggling multiple priorities

- Must love creating, refining, and working with standard operating processes (SOPs)

- Proactive. You don’t wait to be told something is broken, you anticipate it before it breaks

- Must move with a sense of speed and urgency in everything



Ownership & Mindset

- Extremely growth-oriented and hungry to learn

- You are the type of person who follows through every single time, no matter what, and always gets the job done. No excuses, no matter what pops up

- You are the type of person who is delighted when the client or the person you're preparing something for is delighted

- You want meaningful work around people who are incredibly smart, hard-working, and dedicated, with a phenomenal culture. We work hard, but we have fun doing it together



Availability & Technical Requirements

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION IS REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Must be willing to work long hours and be available to respond to messages within a 12-hour daily window (not necessarily working 12 hours a day, but reliably reachable and able to respond quickly if something urgent comes up)



Preferred:

- Experience working as a process engineer, manufacturing engineer, or industrial engineer is preferred, but not required

- Experience designing team workflows, augmenting existing workflows with automation, and/or automating existing workflows is a strong bonus, but not required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.





STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project, estimated to be 2-3 hours of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Team Admin / Assistant / Project Manager with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Client Call Coordinator
description:
We are a fast-growing structural engineering firm based in Australia and is currently looking for a confident and composed Client Call Coordinator with a strong direct background in client calls and client meetings and has worked in a coordinator project management before. A full-time role from 7:00 AM to 3:30 pm Philippines time, weekdays only.



This role involves direct communication with clients— particularly those related to project delays, drawing status, or technical concerns. Your key responsibility is to act as the first point of contact on the phone, provide a warm and professional experience for the client, and coordinate internally with our design team to ensure timely resolutions.



We are ideally looking for someone who is comfortable under pressure, has excellent communication skills, and enjoys solving  in a fast-paced environment.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



Answer incoming client phone calls regarding project updates, delays, or technical questions.



Reassure and guide clients calmly and professionally — especially in high-pressure or escalated situations.



Gather relevant information from clients to assist internal design teams.



Follow up on requests with the design team and ensure clients receive timely responses.



Maintain detailed records of calls and follow-ups using internal systems.



Escalate urgent or complex issues to the appropriate internal tea
mbers.



Build and maintain strong client relationships through consistent and reliable communication.



Assist in improving call-handling procedures and response workflows.



SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:



A university degree or diploma



Previous experience in a client-facing or coordination role is highly desirable.



Excellent verbal communication skills with a calm and empathetic phone manner.



Ability to handle pressure, de-escalate tense situations, and remain composed under stress.



Strong organizational and time management skills.



Comfortable with regular phone interaction as the core part of the role.



Basic understanding of engineering or construction drawings is a PLUS.



Proficient in using collaboration tools (e.g., Teams, CRM systems, call logging software).



NICE TO HAVE:



Familiarity with the design and construction industry.



Experience working with internal engineering or design teams.



Prior work in a support or help desk-style role involving technical discussions.



To apply and be considered, please follow the below: 



1. Please send a link to your most updated CV and a short recording link explaining your relevant experience to the role.

2. Use 3 apply points.



Only those applicants who follow the above instructions will be contacted.

title: Experienced Video Editor (Short-Form + Occasional Ads & Long-Form)
description:
We’re looking for an experienced video editor who will become a true extension of our brand — not just someone who cuts clips, but someone who understands storytelling, retention, and brand tone.



Your primary focus will be short-form social media content, with occasional paid ads and long-form videos as needed.



About Us



We are a wellness-focused pet facility redefining what daycare, boarding, and grooming can look like. Our content blends education, emotional storytelling, and authority positioning — and we need someone who can bring that to life visually.



The Role



You will:



• Edit short-form vertical videos (Instagram Reels & TikTok)

• Work with founder talking-head content

• Turn facility footage into engaging storytelling pieces

• Add captions, dynamic text overlays, b-roll, and subtle motion graphics

• Maintain strong hooks and audience retention

• Occasionally edit paid ads (Meta & TikTok)

• Occasionally edit long-form content (YouTube, educational videos, brand storytelling)

• Repurpose long-form footage into short-form clips



What We’re Looking For



• Proven experience editing short-form social content

• Strong understanding of hooks, pacing, and retention

• Clean, modern editing style (not overly trendy or chaotic)

• Ability to structure content clearly and intentionally

• Experience editing ads is a plus

• Ability to follow brand tone and implement feedback

• Strong communication and reliability



Bonus if you:

• Have worked with founder-led or educational brands

• Understand wellness or holistic concepts

• Can proactively suggest creative direction



Engagement Structure



• This will start as a project-based role to assess fit

• If aligned, it can transition into part-time

• Potential to grow into full-time depending on workload and performance



How to Apply



Please send:



Your portfolio



Your rates



Your availability



???? Important: Include the word “holistic” in the subject line of your application
 so we know you’ve read the full job post.



If you care about storytelling and building something meaningful, we’d love to hear from you. ????

title: Marketing Campaign Specialist
description:
We are looking for an experienced Marketing Campaign Specialist to join our dynamic team.



 

Role Summary 



The Marketing Campaign Specialist is responsible for planning, creating, and executing EDM campaigns to support new vendor partnerships, product launches, and go?to?market initiatives. This role works closely with Cloud, Sales, and Vendor teams) into high?impact customer communications that drive awareness, engagement, and pipeline. 



 



Key Responsibilities 



Campaign & EDM Execution 

-Plan, build, and deploy EDM campaigns for new vendor partnerships and cloud solutions 

-Translate internal campaign requests into clear, compelling customer?facing messaging 

-Manage end?to?end EDM delivery including copy, layout, approvals, scheduling, and reporting 



Vendor & Stakeholder Collaboration 

-Partner with Cloud Business Managers, Sales, and Vendors to align messaging and timing 

-Ensure vendor brand guidelines and co?branding requirements are followed 

-Coordinate approvals with internal stakeholders and external vendors 



Content Development 

-Draft EDM copy including subject lines, headlines, CTAs, and supporting content 

-Adapt messaging for different audiences (customers, partners, internal sales) 

-Support creation of landing pages, campaign briefs, and sales enablement assets 



Campaign Performance & Optimisation 

-Track and report on EDM performance (open rates, CTR, conversions) 

-Optimise subject lines, content, and CTAs based on performance insights 

-Maintain campaign documentation and best?practice templates 



 



Key Deliverables 



-Vendor partnership announcement EDMs 

-Campaign briefs and messaging frameworks 

-Performance reports and insights 

-Co?branded marketing assets 



 



Skills & Experience 



Essential 



-3+ years’ experience in B2B marketing, preferably in IT, cloud, or technology 

-Hands?on experience with EDM/email marketing platforms (e.g. Dynamics, HubSpot, Marketo, Mailchimp) 

-Strong copywriting and messaging skills 

-Proven ability to manage multiple campaigns and deadlines 

-Stakeholder management experience across sales, marketing, and vendors 



 

Desirable 

-Experience working with cloud, SaaS, or vendor?led marketing programs 

-Understanding of channel or partner marketing models 

-Basic knowledge of CRM and marketing automation 



 

Key Competencies 



-Strong communication and attention to detail 

-Commercial mindset with focus on pipeline impact 

-Ability to simplify technical messaging for business audiences 

-Highly organised and deadline?driven 



 

Success Measures 



-On?time delivery of campaign requests 

-Engagement and performance of EDM campaigns 

-Sales and vendor satisfaction with campaign execution 

-Contribution to pipeline and vendor program success 



 Send your resumes to

title: Content & Email Marketing Coordinator (Tourism Platform – Full Time)
description:
We are a fast-growing, New Zealand–owned tourism technology platform connecting activity providers, accommodations and affiliates nationwide, and travellers worldwide.

Our system includes:

• Our own custom-built admin dashboard (developed in-house)

• Landing page creation tools

• Video and image integration

• Separate
 campaigns for customers, affiliates, and suppliers

• Automated booking systems

• Marketing integrations

• Trello for task management

We are now expanding our marketing operations and are looking for a talented, intelligent, and proactive content and
 marketing specialist to help grow our platform.

________________________________________

The Role

This is not just a writing job.

You will help build and manage:

•
 marketing campaigns

• Affiliate onboarding sequences

• Supplier communication campaigns

• Customer newsletters

• Blog content strategy and writing

• Seasonal marketing campaigns

• Content refinement and SEO improvements

• Campaign planning and idea generation

You will work closely with the founder and our developer. You will be given access to the relevant dashboards and tools needed.

________________________________________

What You Will Work With

• Our internal
 system (built in our admin dashboard)

• Landing page creation tools (with video, images, links, and content)

• Separate
 campaigns for:

o Customers

o Affiliates

o Suppliers

• Trello task management system

• Support from our developer for technical updates

Experience with
 marketing platforms such as Klaviyo, Mailchimp, or similar is highly desirable, as this will help you understand campaign structure and automation strategy.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

 Marketing

• Plan and write affiliate onboarding sequences

• Develop supplier education
s

• Create customer newsletters

• Design promotional campaigns

• Align campaigns with seasonal tourism trends

• Support growth initiatives

Blog Content

• 1–2 SEO-optimised blogs per week

• Tourism and destination content

• Campaign-aligned articles

• Clear, accurate, well-structured writing

Marketing Support

• Suggest new campaign ideas

• Help build engagement strategies

• Support affiliate activation

• Assist with seasonal marketing planning

• Contribute to growth thinking

________________________________________

Who We Are Looking For

You must have:

• Excellent written English (near-native level)

• Strong attention to detail

• Experience in
 marketing ie Klaviyo

• Understanding of campaign sequencing

• Basic SEO knowledge

• Ability to think strategically

• Initiative and creativity

• Ability to work independently

• Long-term mindset

Experience in travel, tourism, or destination marketing is a bonus.

We are looking for someone intelligent, organised, and proactive — not someone who only follows instructions.

________________________________________

Work Structure

• Full-time remote position

• Long-term role preferred

• Salary: NZ$1,300 per month to start

• Performance review after 3 months

• Salary increases to NZ$1,600 per month upon successful review

________________________________________

Our Strategic Focus

We are currently in the post-season phase and building strong foundations for the next tourism season.

Your focus will include:

• Affiliate on-boarding and activation

• Supplier communication support 

• Supplier on-boarding and setup

• Customer
 marketing development

• Newsletter launch

• Blog strategy

• Seasonal campaign planning

• Preparing for major campaigns ahead of the next tourism season

Special promotional campaigns will begin later in the year as part of our structured growth strategy.

________________________________________

Application Requirements

Please include:

1. Links to 3 writing samples (blogs or
 campaigns)

2. A short
 introducing 
 to a tourism accommodation partner

3. Confirmation of your experience with
 marketing tools

4. The word Kowhai in your subject line

________________________________________

Why Join Us?

This is an opportunity to work with a growing national tourism platform where your writing and marketing input will directly impact growth.

We value collaboration, clarity, and long-term partnerships.

title: Home Care - Caregiver/Healthcare Recruiter
description:
About Us



At Helper Heroes, we’re on a mission to provide exceptional care and support to home care agencies in America. We believe in creating a true partnership where our employees act and feel like a true member of the American team they are matched with. Our goal is to help them create a compassionate, innovative, and efficient care experience for their clients and their families. To achieve this, we’re looking for a Helper Hero to join our team and help us shine even brighter!



About You



What sets us apart is YOU. You’re not just any virtual tea
mber—you’re a Helper Hero! If you’re passionate about making a difference, have a knack for organization, and thrive in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment, you’re who we are looking for. If you’re the kind of person who loves tackling behind-the-scenes tasks with a smile, ensuring that our clients' caregivers and clients receive the best possible support, apply today!



Job Overview



We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented Recruiter to support recruitment, caregiver

onboarding, and administrative tasks for a growing home care business. This role is

ideal for someone with experience in healthcare recruitment and a passion for

streamlining operations. You will work closely with the owner to alleviate their workload,

enabling them to focus on business growth and client care.



Key Responsibilities



1. Recruitment & Onboarding:



- Manage end-to-end caregiver recruitment: screen applicants, schedule interviews, and coordinate orientation/training.

- Process onboarding documentation via ADP Workforce (e.g., electronic I-9s, employee handbook distribution).

- Track and ensure completion of state-mandated caregiver training (e.g.,via Active Insights).



2. Administrative Support



- Answer inbound calls during peak hours and manage voi
s/lead inquiries.

- Assist with client intake calls and referral source coordination.

- Provide general administrative support (e.g., scheduling, data entry).



3. Systems & Collaboration



- Utilize platforms like WellSky or Axiscare (training provided) to streamline workflows.

- Collaborate with the owner to refine processes and maintain organization.



Qualifications:



- Excellent written/verbal communication (fluent English).

- Strong organizational and time-management abilities.

- Proficiency with CRM systems,
 management, and cloud-based tools (e.g., Google Drive).

- Proactive mindset—anticipate needs before they arise.

- Proven experience in recruitment, preferably in healthcare or home care staffing.

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport with candidates and tea
mbers.

- Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.

- Familiarity with recruitment platforms and CRM tools

- A positive attitude, sense of humor, and a passion for helping others.



Attributes of a Successful Helper Hero:



- Empathy: You genuinely care about people and want to make a difference in their lives.

- Organization: You’re a master of multitasking and can keep everything running smoothly.

- Communication: You speak impeccable English. You’re a clear and friendly communicator, both written and verbal.

- Problem Solver: You can see the big picture when resolving complex issues and follow through until you reach full resolution.

- Self Starter: You work effectively without supervision and follow processes precisely.

- Reliability: You’re dependable, punctual, and always ready to step up when needed.



Why You’ll Love Working with Us:



- Competitive Base Pay: $6.50/hr for the first 6 months. (Among the highest in the homecare industry)

- Make a Difference: You’ll play a key role in ensuring that clients receive the best

care possible.

- Growth Opportunities: As we grow, so will you! There’s plenty of room for

advancement and learning.

- Fun & Supportive Team: We’re a tight-knit group that values collaboration,

compassion, and a good laugh.



Ready to Be a Hero?



If you’re excited about the opportunity to join our team, where you’ll be appreciated,

have a sense of purpose and inclusion and are willing to help us create a brighter, more

compassionate care experience, we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply today and let’s

make a difference together.



IMPORTANT: Directly apply and send your resume on our website: 
/helperheroes/

title: VIDEO EDITOR DTC
description:
Creative Video Editor — LOCK IN (Full-Time, Remote)

We're a gamified self-improvement app for young men scaling through paid social. We need an editor who understands why ads work, not just how to make them look good.

What you'll do

25+ ad creatives per week across Meta and TikTok. You take raw UGC, screen recordings, and content and turn them into ads that make people stop scrolling. You'll be in on strategy calls, feedback loops, and ad reviews. When we tell you an ad won or lost, you need to understand why and apply that to the next one.

What we're looking for

Experience editing UGC ads with real spend behind them. You understand hooks, pacing, and what makes someone tap download. You don't just wait for a brief and execute, you brainstorm, you bring ideas, you think like a marketer who happens to edit.

You don't need crazy After Effects or motion graphics. Most winning ads are built on good research, good messaging, and good copy. We need someone who gets that.

You need to be young and plugged into current culture, trends, and what's actually working on social media right now. Our audience is males 16 to 25. If you don't naturally understand what makes that demo stop scrolling, this isn't the right fit.

Great work ethic and fast response time are non-negotiable.

To apply

Say the word "locked" in your application. Send 3 ads you've edited that had real spend behind them. Answer this: what's one thing most editors get wrong about ad creatives?

- Organization: You’re a master of multitasking and can keep everything running smoothly.

- Communication: You speak impeccable English. You’re a clear and friendly communicator, both written and verbal.

- Problem Solver: You can see the big picture when resolving complex issues and follow through until you reach full resolution.

- Self Starter: You work effectively without supervision and follow processes precisely.

- Reliability: You’re dependable, punctual, and always ready to step up when needed.



Why You’ll Love Working with Us:



- Competitive Base Pay: $6.50/hr for the first 6 months. (Among the highest in the homecare industry)

care possible.

- Growth Opportunities: As we grow, so will you! There’s plenty of room for

Ready to Be a Hero?

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Overview

We're looking for a DevOps engineer to own deployments, infrastructure, and production stability for a growing platform that supports merchants, payments, reporting, and AI-driven workflows.



The product is already largely functional (~75–85%). Your role is to make it safer, smoother, and easier to ship, while keeping things reliable as the system grows.



Responsibilities

* Own and improve deployment pipelines for frontend and backend services.

* Manage and harden production and staging environments.

* Set up and maintain CI/CD, release workflows, and rollback strategies.

* Implement security best practices (secrets, access, auth flows, backups).

* Support live deployments and help troubleshoot production issues.

* Work closely with developers to remove friction in shipping code.

* Improve observability (logs, metrics, alerts) without over-engineering.

* Help the platform scale as data, traffic, and AI usage increase.



Tech & Environment

* Node.js / Express applications

title: Funding Specialist / Credit & Finance Strategist (Base + Commission)
description:
Job Title:

Funding Specialist / Credit & Finance Strategist (Base + Commission)



Compensation Structure:

$5/hour base pay (Flexible)

    •    $50 per approved account

    •    $75 per high-limit approval

Part-Time or Full-Time



High performers can earn significantly more based on results.



?



About Us



We are a U.S.-based credit repair and funding strategy company helping individuals and business owners secure personal and business funding through strategic sequencing and credit positioning.



We are expanding our Funding Department and building a structured Funding CRM. We are looking for someone experienced in credit analysis and funding strategy who can help maximize approvals for our clients.



?



Role Overview



You will manage funding from analysis to approval.



This includes:



• Reviewing 3-bureau credit reports

• Determining funding readiness

• Structuring funding sequences

• Researching banks and credit unions

• Assisting with and submitting applications

• Tracking approvals, limits, and denials

• Updating CRM and Excel tracking sheets

• Communicating with clients throughout the process



This is a strategy-based role, not just application submission.



?



Commission Structure



• $50 for every approved account

• $75 for every high-limit approval



High-limit approval = approvals that meet or exceed company-defined threshold (to be discussed during onboarding).



The more approvals you generate, the more you earn.



?



Core Responsibilities



Credit File Analysis:

• Evaluate utilization, inquiries, age, derogatories

• Identify approval strength

• Flag weaknesses before applying



Funding Strategy:

• Build and execute funding sequences

• Understand inquiry sensitivity

• Track soft vs hard pulls

• Avoid overexposure in a funding round



Tracking & Reporting:

• Maintain Excel tracking sheets

• Log applications submitted

• Track approvals and limits

• Record denial reasons

• Monitor funding sequence progress

• Update CRM consistently



Client Communication:

•
 clients instructions and updates

• Guide them through applications

• Collect required documentation

• Provide approval updates



Goal:

Maximize funding approvals while minimizing denials.



?



Requirements



• Experience with personal funding

• Experience with business funding

• Strong understanding of credit analysis

• Knowledge of funding sequences

• Excel proficiency

• Strong English communication

• Organized and results-driven



Bonus:

• Prior funding company experience

• Understanding underwriting logic

• Experience structuring funding rounds



?



To Apply



Send:

    1.    Your funding experience

    2.    Average funding amounts you’ve helped secure

    3.    Your understanding of funding sequences

    4.    Your availability (hours per week)

    5.    Why you would succeed in a performance-based role

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Role Summary



The Executive Assistant supports a real estate executive/team by managing daily operations across acquisitions, loan processing, project coordination for flips, vendor scheduling, and administrative support. This role keeps deals moving, deadlines met, files complete, and projects organized from contract to close and through renovation.



Key Responsibilities



Loan Processing Support (Primary)

 • Collect and organize borrower documents (ID, income, bank statements, tax returns, entity docs, insurance, etc.)

 • Build and maintain loan files for lenders, brokers, and underwriters

 • Track milestones: pre-approval, appraisal, title, underwriting conditions, clear-to-close

 • Request/pay for third-party items (appraisal, survey, inspections) and track delivery dates

 • Communicate with lenders, loan officers, title companies, insurance agents, and borrowers

 • Review closing disclosures/HUDs for accuracy (fees, payoffs, taxes, wire instructions) and flag issues

 • Maintain a loan pipeline tracker and send weekly status updates



Real Estate Transaction Coordination

 • Coordinate contract execution, addenda, option periods, earnest money, and deadlines

 • Order inspections, surveys, appraisal access, utilities, and lockbox access when needed

 • Work with title/escrow to ensure all documents are received and timelines are met

 • Maintain deal folders with all supporting documents (contract, amendments, title, invoices, receipts)



House Flip Setup + Project Management Support

 • Assist with setting up new flip projects: property binder, scope template, budget, and timeline

 • Collect bids, schedule walkthroughs, and coordinate contractors and vendors

 • Track renovation progress: milestones, payments, change orders, materials deliveries

 • Manage invoices, receipts, lien waivers, and contractor compliance docs

 • Coordinate utilities setup/transfers, insurance updates, permits (as applicable), and trash/dumpster needs

 • Support listing prep: staging, photography scheduling, repair punch lists, and MLS/agent coordination



Administrative + Operations Support

 • Manage executive calendar, calls, appointments, showings, inspections, and contractor schedules

 • Prepare
s, letters, purchase offers, and basic reports for stakeholders

 • Maintain organized file systems (Drive/Dropbox) and standardized naming conventions

 • Handle vendor onboarding, W-9 collection, COIs, and payment tracking

 • Assist with bookkeeping support: expense categorization, reconciliations, and project cost tracking

 • Run errands and handle miscellaneous tasks tied to deals (as needed)



Tools / Systems (Preferred)

 • Google Workspace or Microsoft Office (Docs/Sheets/Excel)

 • CRM or transaction tools (DocuSign, Dotloop, Skyslope, etc.)

 • Project tracking (Trello, Asana, Monday, ClickUp)

 • Basic accounting familiarity (QuickBooks or similar)



Qualifications

 • 2+ years supporting a real estate professional, investor, or lending team (preferred)

 • Strong understanding of real estate transaction timelines and loan documentation (preferred)

 • Extremely organized, deadline-driven, and comfortable handling sensitive financial documents

 • Clear communication skills with vendors, lenders, title companies, and clients

 • Able to juggle multiple deals/projects at once with minimal supervision



Skills That Matter

 • File management and attention to detail (no missing docs, no sloppy deadlines)

 • Follow-up and persistence (politely annoying people until things get done)

 • Budget tracking and vendor coordination

 • Professional discretion and confidentiality



Success Metrics

 • Loan files submitted complete with minimal back-and-forth conditions

 • Deadlines met across multiple transactions and flip timelines

 • Vendor schedules aligned and projects moving without delays

 • Accurate trackers and clean documentation for every property

title: Amazon online arbitrage / A2A / A2A EU virtual assistant (Minimum 1 year previous experience)
description:
***MINIMUM 1 YEAR EXPERIENCE IS A MUST, DO NOT APPLY IF YOU CANNOT SHOW ME PREVIOUS EXAMPLE LEADS. AS I WILL IGNORE YOUR APPLICATION***



Job Description:



We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Virtual Assistant from the Philippines to join our team on a full-time basis. The ideal candidate will have proven experience in Amazon online arbitrage sourcing for the UK market, a bonus would be having A2A sourcing skills and A2A EU sourcing skills this will make you stand out compared to the other candidates. If you have A2A experience please highlight this in your application as well as when you send over your previous example leads



We are currently in search of 2 full time virtual assistants



Having experience with Keepa product finder is a must as this is the tool we use to find majority of the leads as well as experience with Seller amp as this is what we use to analyse the deals



Responsibilities:

• Source unique, high-profit and medium-profit deals on Amazon UK, focusing on high-ticket niches such as electronics, home & kitchen, toys, Computers and accessories. (Anything with a sell price of above £50 NO MAKEUP) 

• Ensure all leads are exclusive and not shared with other clients.

• Deliver high-quality, consistent sourcing leads in a timely manner.

• Present leads in a well-organized Excel sheet format with all necessary data points (e.g., cost price, Amazon selling price, profit, ROI, ASIN, etc.).

• Using coupons and taking into account student discount etc when sourcing. 

•Source from unique websites and ensure they are legit and not scam websites by checking trustpilot



Requirements:

• Proven experience in Amazon online arbitrage sourcing for the UK market – this is non-negotiable.

• Must be able to provide examples of previous sourcing work.

• Each deal should have a minimum profit of £10 and a minimum ROI of 20%.

•No oversaturated brands/websites such as Ryobi, Milwaukee, notino and etc

• Must be reliable, detail-oriented, and trustworthy – we value loyalty and hard work, and we take care of our tea
mbers who are committed and dedicated.

• Strong communication skills and the ability to follow instructions independently.

• All leads must be exclusive and not reused or recycled across other clients.



If you’ve read this far and would like to apply, please use the word “Ready” in your application title so I know you have read and understood everything, without this title I will ignore your application. You must also apply with your previous work/example of deal sheet. Without this we will not read your application.



Must also be able to find 5-10 high quality leads a day within the specified criteria above. Your previous work/deal sheet should highlight this.



To get a better understanding of what we require I have attached a training proposal below, please ensure you read it thoroughly to understand our expectations 









Thank you I look forward to your applications and viewing your previous results



Salary will be discussed once you apply. Starting is £250 a month with performance based bonuses and base salary increase out our discretion.

title: Dispatcher (Carrier Side)
description:

s and speak professionally on calls)

Experience with DAT/Truckstop and a TMS, strong negotiation and customer service skills, understanding of detention/TONU processes

title: Freight Broker Agent
description:
We’re hiring a Freight Broker Agent who can generate freight through outside sales while also recruiting and building a reliable carrier network. This role is for someone who knows logistics, can close, and communicates clearly and professionally. Excellent English (spoken and written) is required.



Key Responsibilities



Outside Sales (Primary)

 • Prospect and win new shipper accounts (cold calls,
s, networking, referrals)

 • Build and manage a book of business with consistent freight volume

 • Develop pricing strategies, lane proposals, and long-term account relationships

 • Provide professional updates and service recovery when issues come up

 • Track activity and pipeline (calls, meetings, quotes sent, accounts won)



Brokerage Operations

 • Quote loads accurately and negotiate rates with shippers and carriers

 • Post, cover, and manage loads from tender to delivery

 • Coordinate with dispatch/ops to ensure on-time pickup and delivery

 • Handle exceptions: delays, reschedules, claims documentation, detention/TONU requests

 • Maintain clean load notes, confirmations, and documentation



Carrier Recruitment (Secondary but important)

 • Recruit and onboard carriers/owner-operators to support key lanes

 • Verify carrier compliance documents: MC/DOT, insurance/COI, W-9, authority, safety rating (as required)

 • Build preferred carrier lists for repeat lanes and reduce fall-offs

 • Maintain strong relationships with carriers for coverage and performance



Requirements

 • Proven experience in freight brokerage and logistics (agent or broker role)

 • Excellent English (must write clear
s and speak confidently with shippers and carriers)

 • Strong sales ability: prospecting, objection handling, closing, and account management

 • Strong understanding of lanes, rates, margin management, and service expectations

 • Organized, responsive, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment



Preferred Qualifications

 • Existing book of business (a plus, not required unless you want it to be)

 • Experience with DAT/Truckstop and a TMS/CRM

 • Strong carrier network and recruiting experience

 • Comfortable working with KPIs (calls, quotes, cover rate, margin, on-time performance)



Key Skills

 • Negotiation and relationship building

 • Fast problem solving under pressure

 • Professional communication (no sloppy
s, no unclear calls)

 • Attention to detail on rate confirmations, load details, and documentation



Performance Expectations (Examples)

 • Consistent outbound activity and pipeline growth

 • New shipper accounts added monthly

 • Loads covered with strong service and controlled fall-off rate

 • Healthy margins while maintaining on-time performance

*** PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE DESCRIPTION BEFORE APPLYING ***





IMPORTANT:



- We are ONLY looking for candidates with REAL B2B cold calling experience.  

- If you have only worked warm leads, inbound calls, or appointment setting from ads, do not apply.



COMPANY INFO:



- My name is Jordan. I am the founder of a fast-growing company that helps small businesses never miss a call using an A.I. Receptionist.

- This is a simple, high-demand service that business owners immediately understand. We are looking for 1–2 strong cold callers to help introduce it to small business owners across the U.S.

- We are not a large corporate call center. We work closely with a small team and focus on rewarding performance.



WHAT YOU WILL DO:



- Source your own B2B leads

- Cold call small business owners

- Book them for a free consultation

- Ensure they show up to the call

- You do not close deals.  Our closing team handles everything after.  Your only job is to get them to show-up.



MUST HAVE (DO NOT APPLY IF THIS DOES NOT DESCRIBE YOU):



- Proven B2B cold calling experience

- Strong English with no heavy accent

- Reliable internet and a quiet workspace

- Comfortable making high-volume outbound calls

- Put the phrase “I love to dial” in your subject line



COMPENSATION:



- We offer 2 pay plans:

----- $25 per attended show-up

----- $100 per closed deal

----- Monthly performance bonuses

OR

----- $2/hour + $25/show-up

(The first pay plan is preferred as we are looking for a true hustler)



HOURS:



- Part-time (20 hours per week) with the option to transition to full time

- Schedule: 2:00 AM – 6:00 AM Philippine Time



HOW TO APPLY:



- Do not send a generic message.

- In your application, include 2 things: Your specific B2B cold calling experience AND why this role fits you

- Do not use chat GPT or similar responses, those will be rejected.

title: Experienced Virtual Psychometrician or Psychologist
description:
Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled Virtual Psychometrician or Psychologist to join our team. This role involves administering, scoring, and interpreting psychological and educational assessments in a virtual environment. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in psychometrics or psychology, with a focus on maintaining HIPAA and FERPA compliance, and exceptional attention to detail in both report writing and communication. The person must have availability during USA Eastern or Pacific time zone business hours to ensure seamless collaboration and support.



Key Responsibilities:

• Administer psychological and educational assessments in a virtual setting

• Score assessments accurately and efficiently using provided tools and guidelines

• Interpret data and provide insights to inform recommendations for support and intervention

• Prepare detailed and accurate reports with professionalism and clarity

• Ensure strict adherence to privacy standards, including HIPAA and FERPA regulations

• Communicate effectively with school psychologists, educators, and tea
mbers

• Maintain confidentiality and ethical guidelines in handling sensitive information

• Stay updated on assessment tools, technologies, and best practices in virtual psychometric or psychological work



Qualifications:

• Master’s or Doctoral degree in psychology, educational psychology, or a related field

• Experience as a psychometrician or psychologist, administering and interpreting assessments

• Proficiency with assessment tools and scoring software (e.g., WISC, BASC, Woodcock-Johnson, or similar)

• Strong knowledge of privacy regulations, including HIPAA and FERPA

• Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in report writing and scoring

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills for accurate and professional reporting

• Proficient in using technology for virtual assessments (e.g., Zoom, online assessment platforms)

• Ability to work independently and maintain high standards of professionalism

• Availability during USA Eastern or Pacific time zone business hours



Compensation:

Pay is negotiable based on experience.



Application Process:

To apply for this position, candidates MUST complete all three of the following steps:

1. Submit a resume outlining relevant experience.

2. Upload proof of credentials (e.g., certification or licensure in psychometrics or psychology).

3. Submit a link to a newly created video introduction where you:

• State the current date (to verify it’s a new video).

• Explain your experience in administering and interpreting assessments.

• Highlight your attention to detail in report writing and your approach to maintaining HIPAA and FERPA compliance.



Important Application Instructions:

• Applications must be submitted through the following link: 
/4130RpL

• Applications submitted directly on other platforms will not be considered.

• Do not apply if you do not complete all requirements as described above.

• Old video introductions or videos that do not include the required components will not be considered.



We look forward to reviewing your application and seeing how your expertise can support our mission to provide high-quality services!

title: Pixel Art Animator Needed for 2D Fighting Game MVP
description:
I am developing a competitive 2D fighting game inspired by titles such as Street Fighter Zero, Arcana Heart, Guilty Gear XX, and Akatsuki Blitzkampf.  Pre-production is complete, and I am now moving into production animation for a 1-character MVP using a limited, anime-style sprite approach. 



What’s already prepared

    • Model sheet and additional illustrations of the character

    • Detailed descriptions of the desired animation

    • Clearly defined animation timing targets and in-game use cases

    • Placeholder animation keyframes prepared for all character actions 

    • Placeholder rough in-between frames of every move

    • A polished complete frame of the target style

    • A development 
 server for fast communication

    • Direct access to the designer for questions and clarification





Your responsibilities

    • Create pixel art animation to be used for the game. (Aseprite is preferred.)

    • Interpret the notes to make clean, efficient animation

    • Have an emphasis is on strong key poses, clean silhouettes, and efficient use of held frames rather than high frame counts

    • Produce approximately 200 total animation frames at ~200px height per sprite

    • Maintain consistent pixel structure, silhouette clarity, and color limits (24 colors maximum per sprite).

    • Communicate progress and issues through 



Requirements

    • Experience with sprite animation

    • Ability to read and follow documentation and placeholder animatics

    • Good written English

    • Familiarity with 2D fighting games is a plus, but not required

    • Experience with Aseprite is a bonus (but not mandatory)

    • This role is best suited for animators who have previously completed sprite-based animation projects



Work details

    • Part-time preferred (Approximately 15–25 hours per week depending on availability and production phase.) Full time considered.

    • Paid position

    • Interview required before hiring

    • Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a small paid animation test (Winifred's standing light attack) before full onboarding. (Estimate scope: 4-5 frames)

    • Weekly check-ins are expected, with a general response time of ~24 hours

    • I am available for quick clarification and guidance as needed

    • Successful collaboration on the MVP may lead to ongoing work for additional characters and content in the game’s full demo





Project overview

The game is a weapon-based fantasy fighting game set in a world of anthropomorphic characters Fighters use swords, axes, and other weapons in one-on-one combat. The MVP will focus on a single fully playable character.  



If you are interested, please send:

    • A brief introduction

    • Your animation experience

    • Any relevant previous work or projects (if available)





Sample Artwork



Sprite Reference (Pixel Art)

Here is what the character looks like and what you need to recreate on each frame. (Pixel art by Satobana)


 



Character Design Reference (Model Sheet)

Concept/model reference artwork used for character proportions, costume details, and visual consistency. (Settei by Taphris)


 





In-Game Presentation Reference (Final Visual Target)

Example of final-tier in-game presentation quality for character cut-ins and effects. (Illustration by Kojima Video)





Examples of Animation Fidelity

As mentioned before, this game uses a limited animation style with smears and held frames rather than Disney-style full animation.  These are example placeholder frames of what animation will look like. (NOT Final, just placeholders)













Initial MVP Scope

    • Single playable character (Winifred)

    • Accompanying VFX sprites for moves

title: Data Extraction and Automation Specialist
description:
Company Overview



We are seeking a skilled Data Extraction and Automation Specialist who understands modern web scraping, lead data enrichment, automation workflows, and structured data management. Availability during U.S. Eastern hours is required.



Position Overview



We are hiring a Web Scraping and Lead Data Automation Specialist to support advanced list building, structured data extraction, and enrichment workflows. This role focuses on pulling targeted lead data at scale using Apify, Python, Clay, and APIs.



This is a hands on technical role for someone who understands scraping logic, selectors, pagination, anti-bot challenges, deduplication, and data normalization.



Key Responsibilities



• Build and maintain lead scraping workflows using Apify actors or Python

• Extract structured data from websites, directories, databases, and public sources

• Handle pagination, login flows, rate limits, and anti-scraping mechanisms

• Clean, dedupe, and normalize datasets

• Enrich scraped data using Clay

• Connect scraped and enriched data to CRM systems, Google Sheets, or CSV exports

• Build or integrate APIs for data transfer when needed

• Document scraping workflows and error handling processes

• Monitor automation health and troubleshoot broken workflows

• Deliver clean, structured lead lists ready for outbound campaigns



Qualifications



• Proven experience with web scraping using Apify or Python

• Strong understanding of HTML, CSS selectors, DOM structure

• Experience handling structured data formats such as JSON, CSV, and Excel

• Familiarity with REST APIs and authentication methods

• Experience using Clay for data enrichment

• Ability to troubleshoot scraping failures and adjust extraction logic

• Strong organizational skills and documentation habits

• Availability during U.S. Eastern hours



Preferred Skills



• Experience scraping education, healthcare, legal, or local business databases

• Familiarity with n8n, Zapier, or Make

• Experience integrating scraped data into Instantly, Apollo, Go High Level, or other CRMs

• Understanding of proxy management and anti-bot mitigation



Compensation



Pay is negotiable based on experience and technical depth.



Application Process



To apply for this position, candidates MUST complete all of the following steps:

 1. Submit a resume outlining web scraping and automation experience.

 2. Upload examples or screenshots of previous scraping projects or data extraction workflows.

 3. Submit a newly recorded video introduction where you:

• State the current date

• Explain your experience with web scraping, Apify, Python, and Clay

• Describe a scraping workflow you built and how you handled errors or blocked requests



Important Application Instructions



• Applications must be submitted through this link: 
/4130RpL

• Applications submitted directly on other platforms will not be reviewed

• All steps must be completed to be considered

title: Property Management Assistant
description:
Company Overview

Learn more about us here:





We have worked successfully with remote tea
mbers for several years and have well-established systems, processes, and training in place.



Position Overview



This position supports homeowners associations only and does not involve commercial or residential rental property management.



We are seeking a full-time, long-term remote tea
mber to support our HOA management team as a Property Management Assistant.



This role is ideally intended for candidates who already have experience working with homeowners associations. This is not an entry-level role. A candidate without HOA experience would be considered, but they would need to have considerable property management experience.



This is not a short-term contract position.



Key Responsibilities



• Respond to homeowner
s and service requests

• Document notes and correspondence in our HOA management system

• Coordinate with vendors and follow up on work orders

• Assist with board packets, reports, and notices

• Support compliance tracking, mailings, and administrative HOA tasks

• Communicate professionally with homeowners, board members, and vendors



Systems and Training



• We use Vantaca, a modern HOA management CRM with a full training library

• Microsoft Teams is used for internal communication

• A shared company inbox is used for
 management

• RingPlan is used for phone calls with homeowners and vendors

• We are experienced in training and integrating remote tea
mbers quickly



You do not need prior experience with our specific systems.



Work Schedule



• Monday through Friday

• 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Pacific Time

• Lunch and breaks as needed



Requirements



• Experience working with homeowners associations or a strong property management background

• Strong written English and professional communication skills

• Organized, detail-oriented, and calm under pressure

• Comfortable handling homeowner and vendor communication

• Comfortable working US business hours

• Looking for a long-term role with an established company

• PTO is use-it-or-lose-it and does not roll over

• Any unused PTO is paid out in the December paycheck

• Paid birthday off

• Raises based on performance and longevity

• Long-term stability with a company operating for nearly 60 years



HOW TO APPLY



Follow the steps exactly to be considered.



• Use a minimum of 5 AP points

• Include the following subject line: YOUR NEW PROPERTY MANAGEMENT ASSISTANT



Please apply with a brief message that includes:



• Your experience working with homeowners associations in any capacity

• Your resume

• How long you typically stay in roles

• Why you are interested in a long-term position with an established company

• Confirmation that you understand we will not hire applicants who are working with other companies, as this is a full-time position that must be your number one priority

• Confirmation that you understand the working hours are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Pacific Time

• DISC testing results

• Confirmation whether you used any AI tools to help write your application. This will not disqualify you. We simply value transparency.



Qualified candidates will receive a calendar link to schedule a Zoom interview with the CEO and Director of HOA Management.
