title: HIPAA-Certified Cold Caller VA
description:
Our client is launching a small pilot program to revive Inspira’s “Not Taken Under Care”

(N-TUC) leads stored in SmartMD. These are previously warm PACE prospects who did not

enroll. The purpose of the calls is not to sell, but to conduct CMS-compliant, supportive “Care

Calls” to check in, re-open communication, and route interested individuals back to enrollment if

they request help.



The VA will operate under strict HIPAA and CMS marketing compliance guidelines, ensuring

calls are framed as general outreach/education and not enrollment steering. This pilot may

expand across additional PACE organizations if successful.



This role aligns primarily with:



- Cold Calling / Outbound Sales Support

- Healthcare Virtual Assistant

- HIPAA-Certified Administrative Support



Responsibilities:



- Conduct outbound “Care Calls” to N-TUC leads using CMS-safe scripting

- Clearly communicate supportive, non-sales intent

- Follow strict opt-out and “do not contact” protocols (1 no = stop future calls)

- Document call outcomes accurately inside SmartMD (or designated CRM)

- Escalate interested individuals to enrollment team per protocol

- Flag compliance-sensitive scenarios immediately

- Maintain HIPAA-compliant handling of PHI at all times

- Participate in script training and quality assurance reviews

- Meet measurable outreach targets (calls per hour / weekly benchmarks TBD)



Requirements:



- HIPAA certification (preferred) or willingness to obtain immediately

- Prior experience in cold calling or outbound outreach

- Strong verbal communication skills with empathetic tone

- Experience in healthcare, Medicare, Medicaid, or PACE preferred

- Comfortable following strict scripts and compliance guardrails

- High attention to documentation accuracy

- Available to start immediately



Hours & Schedule:



- Pilot phase: 5–10 hours per week

- Flexible scheduling aligned with target call windows (likely business hours in client’s time

zone)

- Potential to expand hours if pilot scales across additional PACE organizations



Interested? Please apply on this link: 
.com/wellaware-apply

title: Call Center VA Team Leader / Appointment Setting Manager (Long-Term)
description:
About the Role:

We are a fast-growing, premium home improvement company in the United States. We run a dedicated VA call center that:

-Calls past customers and warm leads

-Call past lost customers

-Calls homeowners around recent storms

-Calls new construction neighborhoods with new homeowner offers

-Calls neighbors around our active and recent builds

The goal: book high-quality in-home appointments for our sales team.



We’re looking for a world-class VA Team Leader / Appointment Setting Manager to own this department: manage the callers, track performance, coach daily, and protect the quality of appointments.



What You’ll Own:

You will be responsible for:

Managing a team of VAs who call:

-Past customers and old leads in our CRM

-Storm-affected areas in our service markets

-New construction communities

-Neighbors around our current and recent projects

-Making sure each list is understood and worked correctly (script/offer matched to list type)

-Running daily huddles and weekly performance reviews

-Listening to call recordings, doing QA, and giving concrete coaching

-Tracking and reporting daily & weekly KPIs:

*Dials / contacts per VA

*Talk time

*Appointments set

*Appointment show rate

-Making sure appointments are:

*With qualified homeowners in our target areas

*Booked for the correct offer (storm, new construction, neighbor, past customer, etc.)

*Correctly entered into our CRM with accurate notes and tags

-Coordinating with our US team to match calendar availability and neighborhood / storm priorities

-Hiring, onboarding, and removing VAs as needed to keep a high-performance team



You are judged on team output and quality, not just busyness.



Requirements (Non?Negotiable):

-2+ years experience as a Team Leader / Supervisor / Manager in an outbound call center or BPO (not just an agent)

-Proven results managing appointment-setting or sales teams (you can show numbers)

-Experience calling US/Canada homeowners or consumer markets is a plus

-Excellent spoken and written English – neutral or very light accent

-Strong with CRMs and reporting (GoHighLevel experience is a plus)

-Comfortable working US hours EST/ night shift (Philippines time)

-Stable work-from-home setup:

*Reliable laptop/PC

*Backup internet

*Quiet environment for calls / coaching



We are looking for someone serious, accountable, and numbers-driven.



What We Offer

-Full-time, long-term role (not project-based)

-Competitive salary in PHP plus performance bonuses based on team results

-Clear scorecard and expectations

-Supportive, growth-focused leadership

-Work with an established US company with strong reputation and systems



How To Apply (Read Carefully)

***If you skip any step, we will not review your application.

-Subject line: CALL CENTER MANAGER – [Your Name]

-In your message, answer these questions briefly:

*How many agents have you managed at one time?

*What KPIs did you track weekly?

*What were your team’s last 3 months average results (appointments per agent per day, show rate, or sales)?



Attach your CV/resume.



Send a 2–3 minute audio or Loom video explaining your experience managing outbound teams and different list types (past customers, cold neighborhoods, storm campaigns, etc.).

title: FRACTIONAL CFO & ECOM DATA ANALYST
description:
THE MISSION



You are the financial architect of the brand.



Your role is to ensure every dollar spent on Meta, TikTok, inventory, or 3PL logistics is accounted for, optimized, and producing a return. You will provide the financial “pulse” that allows leadership to scale aggressively with clarity and confidence.



Our goal is to maintain 100% financial transparency, protect a 35–40% Contribution Margin, and position the company for a $15M+ valuation.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Daily & Monthly P&L Management



• Build and maintain a daily financial P&L (Net Revenue, COGS, Ad Spend, Contribution Margin)

• Monitor financial performance and identify margin fluctuations

• Detect and report money leaks (software waste, team inefficiencies, shipping overages)



3PL Audit & Logistics Analysis



• Weekly reconciliation of 3PL invoices vs Shopify raw data

• Identify billing errors, hidden fees, or overcharges

• Analyze shipping zones, weight classes, and fulfillment costs to protect margins



Inventory Forecasting & Cost Analysis



• Create 30 / 90 / 180-day forecasts aligned with growth and creative launch velocity

• Manage and optimize Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC)

• Support planning for large inventory runs: deposits, reorder timing, and cash allocation



Tax & Compliance (AU & US)



• Prepare and submit Australian BAS statements

• Assist with annual tax strategy and compliance (AU + US Sales Tax / Nexus)

• Ensure financial accuracy and audit readiness



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



• 3+ years experience working with 8-figure DTC / e-commerce brands

• Advanced proficiency in:

Xero

Shopify (Advanced Reporting)

Google Sheets / Excel (financial modeling & dashboards)

• Strong analytical mindset — able to turn numbers into insights and recommendations

• Experience working with founders and scaling brands preferred



SAMPLE WEEKLY FLOW



Morning: Input Meta/TikTok spend + Shopify sales into Daily P&L

Tuesday: Audit 3PL fulfillment report vs Shopify order IDs

title: AI Automation Developer - Claude Code
description:
We're building something most businesses haven't even realised is possible.



Pet Let is an Australian holiday rental company that's been operating since 2009. We have a large property portfolio, a team across two countries, and a database of more than 13,000 guests.

And we're in the middle of building a fully AI-powered operation.

Not chatbots. Not auto-replies. A genuine network of AI agents that can run core business functions — guest communications, operations coordination, financial processing, reporting, and marketing — with a lean human team providing oversight and handling what genuinely needs human judgment.

We have a diverse tech stack including a property management system, a property operations and task management platform, trust accounting software, and Google Workspace as our communications and data backbone. Your job is to connect all of it to Claude, and build agents and dashboards on top of those connections that make the whole business smarter and faster.

We know where we're going. We need someone to help us get there.



What the role looks like:

You'll work directly with our CEO and Operations Manager. You'll design, build, and deploy — hands on, every day.  You ask questions, dig deep, can understand business processes.  You think and understand fast.  



The work has two major pillars:

AI agents — using MCP servers to connect Claude directly to our business systems, then building agents that can act autonomously across those systems: receiving inputs, making decisions, triggering actions, and closing the loop without a human in the middle.



Live dashboards — building real-time operational and business dashboards that give leadership and each team a clear view of what's happening and what needs attention. You choose the right tool for the job.



Beyond that, the roadmap is broad and the problems are real. You'll have genuine ownership of meaningful work from day one.



Who we're looking for

You live in Claude. You've shipped Claude Artifacts. You use Claude Cowork and Code daily and you love letting it do the heavy lifting while you direct the outcome.  Clawdbot/Moltbot/OpenClaw blew your mind.  And now the hype is over, you get what the future looks like and you want to ride that wave.  



You understand MCP — ideally you've built MCP servers and you get why they're the key to turning Claude from an assistant into an agent that can actually act in real systems.

You know Python. You can read an API and build a connection. You've built dashboards that pull live data and help people make decisions.

You don't need to be managed. You need a clear problem and the trust to solve it.

Honestly? We're looking for someone who gets so excited about this stuff that the idea of locking yourself away with your favourite drink, your favourite snacks, and a massive problem to solve sounds less like work and more like the best possible way to spend a day. Our CEO is currently losing sleep because she's so energised by what's possible. We want someone who gets that feeling.



Non-negotiable:



Fluent in Python

Deep, daily Claude user — Artifacts, Claude Code, the works

Understands and has worked with MCP

Has built things with the Claude or OpenAI API and can show us

Can build interactive dashboards connected to live data

Strong written English

Self-directed and genuinely motivated by this technology



Strong advantage:



Google Workspace API experience

Workflow automation (n8n, Make, Zapier)

Experience with agentic frameworks

Any background in hospitality, property management, or operational businesses





About the salary — let's be straight with you

We're starting at $800–$1,200 USD/month. We'll be honest about why: we've been burnt before by people who interview well but can't execute. So we start cautious.

But here's the flip side. If you can do what this ad describes — if you can take our vision and actually ship it, fast — your value to us goes up dramatically and your rate will reflect that. We'll review your compensation as soon as the first element of the vision is live and working, which could be within the first two weeks. After that, regular reviews tied directly to progress.

We're not looking for someone to pay minimally and keep there. We're looking for someone who proves they're exceptional and then gets rewarded for it. If that's you, this is a very good opportunity.



What we offer



Contract  — 40 hours/week

Bonus

Starting remuneration of $800–$1,200 USD/month with fast review based on delivery

Direct access to decision-makers — no layers, no bureaucracy

Real ownership of a genuinely ambitious project

A business that is all-in on this and moving fast





How to apply

Send us three things:



Who you are and why this excites you — keep it honest and specific

Something you've built using Claude or another AI API — a link, a repo, a demo, a description. Show us how you think and what you ship

Your answer to this: If you were connecting Claude to a business system via MCP, what's the first tool you'd expose and why?



Applications without examples of real work will not be considered.



Pet Let has been making holidays better for pet owners since 2009. We think AI is about to let us do that at a level that simply wasn't possible before. Come help us build it.

title: Legal Drafter – Family Law Specialist
description:
Legal Drafter – Family Law Specialist

Full-Time | Remote | Based in the Philippines | Australian Eastern Daylight Time

Monthly Salary: PHP 45,000

???? Apply here: 



About the Role

We’re hiring a skilled and experienced Family Law Specialist to support our team through high-volume legal drafting focused on Australian family law. This is a role for someone who thrives on precision, structure, and fast-paced legal work — not a stepping-stone, but a long-term opportunity to deepen your expertise in family law drafting.

You’ll use custom templates and tools to draft agreements and applications across a variety of family law matters, collaborating closely with internal staff to ensure clarity, compliance, and timely delivery. A strong command of Clio is a major advantage, as our team is currently migrating systems and looking for someone who can onboard quickly and confidently.



Key Responsibilities

? Draft applications and agreements related to divorce, financial settlements, parenting plans, and prenuptial arrangements

? Use our custom-built drafting software and templates to generate clear and accurate legal documents

? Coordinate with internal staff to meet Australian Family Law compliance requirements

? Manage a high volume of drafting assignments with accuracy and speed

? Follow internal quality-control processes to minimize errors and protect client outcomes

? Adapt to internal systems and tools — including Clio — to streamline legal operations

? Track deadlines, progress matters, and communicate clearly with the broader team



Qualifications & Skills

? Accredited Family Law Specialist with substantial drafting experience

? Strong understanding of Australian family law, including divorce applications, consent orders, and financial agreements

? Proficiency in Clio or similar legal practice management software is highly preferred

? Exceptional written English and legal drafting skills

? Strong personal systems for managing volume work without sacrificing accuracy

? Responsive, professional, and collaborative team player

? Detail-focused: understands the risk of even small errors in legal drafting

? Comfortable adopting new tools and workflows (training provided)

? Stable remote setup (own computer, reliable internet; second monitor strongly preferred for speed and accuracy)

title: Founding Head of Digital Creative (AI tools expert -Video editor / creator)
description:
AI DRIVEN Founding Digital Creative Lead for a music start-up group



We’re building something ambitious: a tech-powered music movement driven by AI, storytelling, and bold creative execution.

Right now, we need one person to take ownership of it _ no excuses, just action and responsibility-centered attitude 



This isn’t a “social media poster” role. It’s a command position. You will architect our entire digital presence for two primary music bands across YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, X 
), and
 (main + fan pages). You’ll design the strategy, build the systems, and execute at a level that proves you’re capable of eventually leading a full creative department.



In the beginning, you’ll be hands-on. You’ll build the engine (processes, schedules, flow, etc). And as we scale, you’ll build and lead the team.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow with a company that sees them as a trusted future Head of Digital Creative -but for now, you’ll need to demonstrate that you can own performance, innovation, and results.



The Mission

You will take full control of our digital growth, creative direction, and performance strategy using the latest AI tools available. Every post, short, reel, long-video, visual, and AI-generated asset will run through your creative leadership. Your success will be measured by engagement, growth, consistency, and creative impact.



What You’ll Own:

- Creative Direction & Strategy (with our input / ideas of course) – Build and execute a cohesive AI-powered content vision across all platforms (short-form, long-form, visuals, audio, lip-sync, experimental formats).

- Multi-Platform Growth Leadership – Design and manage structured 30-day content calendars optimized for each platform’s algorithm, target audience and culture.

- AI Content Production – Use advanced generative tools (video, image, audio, LLMs, prompt engineering) to create high-output, high-quality content efficiently.

- Performance Optimization – Analyze weekly data, identify viral hooks, test variations, and refine strategy based on measurable results.

- Brand Voice & Systems – Develop prompt frameworks and AI workflows that maintain consistent tone, aesthetic, and storytelling across platforms.

- Community & Engagement Management – Implement AI-assisted systems to maintain strong audience interaction, including comments and DMs.

- Able to benchmark market trends, anticipate future trends based on our input, revelation of Company direction to stay ahead of the rest.

- Future Team Leadership – As growth accelerates, prepare to recruit, train, and manage editors, designers, and VAs under your direction.



Who You Are

- First, you're a good, trustworthy and dependable person of character who understands that work is responsibility & service first.

- Experienced in creative direction, content strategy, and hands-on social media growth.

- Highly AI-literate i.e, comfortable using LLMs, generative video tools, AI design platforms, and automation systems (we will test your practical ability).

- Deeply knowledgeable about YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, Shorts, Reels, and emerging platform trends — including how virality and engagement actually works (or ready and able to learn really fast).

- Capable of turning raw concepts into structured campaigns with clear performance goals.

- Exceptionally organized, efficient, and performance-driven.

- Strong communicator with excellent written and verbal English.

- Energized, thrilled by creativity, experimentation -you love building, testing, iterating, and refining.

- Ready for creative autonomy (and very comfortable asking for help, advice, clarification, ideas, second opinion etc) -and accountable for results.



The Opportunity:

- Fully remote.

- Full-time preferred (part-time possible if transitioning quickly to full-time).

- Competitive compensation based on capability and results.

- Long-term, stable growth path.

- Clear trajectory toward leading your own department as the company expands.

- Immediate start.



Final Note: This role is for someone who wants more than a job.

If you want to prove yourself, build something from the ground up, and grow into a leadership position inside a forward-thinking music company, -this is your moment.

title: Finance & Admin Assistant
description:
Company: Optometry Practice (Australian)

Location: Remote (Philippines-based preferred)

Hours: Part-time (15–20 hours per week, with potential to grow full-time)

Start: ASAP



About the role : 



Our client is a growing optometry practice in Australia, combining professional eye care services with retail eyewear. As they grow, they’re looking for a Finance & Admin Assistant who can take ownership of their bookkeeping and operational admin support.



This role exists to help free up their Business/Operations Manager from day-to-day finance and administrative work.

You’ll be working closely with the Business Manager, Practice Manager, and Practice Owner to ensure their finances are accurate, their reporting is clear, and their backend systems are organised and documented.



This is a role for someone who enjoys clean numbers, clear systems, and taking initiative.



What you’ll be doing: 

-Finance & Bookkeeping (Primary Focus)

-Managing bookkeeping in Xero

-Inputting accounts payable and supplier statements

-Setting up and maintaining bank rules

-Preparing manual journals

-Producing monthly activity statements

-Preparing quarterly BAS

-Running Profit & Loss reports

-Applying correct Australian GST treatment

-Preparing Monthly Data Stock Usage Reports and analysis

-Learning our revenue streams and how transactions should be treated

-Documenting finance processes into clear SOPs





Admin & Operational Support. :

-Clearing and managing the Business/Operations Manager’s inbox

-Liaising with the Practice Manager regarding next steps

-Gathering data and providing concise summaries

-Reviewing and updating policy and procedure manuals

-'Keeping digital filing organised (Dropbox, shared folders)

-Supporting general admin tasks such as research, bookings, and coordination



You’re a great fit if you…

-Have an Accounting degree or strong Australian bookkeeping experience

-Are confident using Xero

-Have experience preparing BAS and handling GST correctly

-Can prepare Profit & Loss statements and manual journals

-Are detail-oriented and organised

-Can think beyond step-by-step instructions and apply logic

-Are comfortable working with a direct, time-poor manager

-Can figure out who to ask for what  and when to solve something independently

-Are reliable  when you say yes, you mean yes

-Take initiative and care about doing things properly

-Are emotionally intelligent and able to adjust to different personalities

-Can work independently without needing constant supervision



Nice to have : 

-Experience working in service-based + retail businesses

-Experience in medical or healthcare environments

-Experience documenting processes and creating SOPs





What we offer : 

-Flexible, remote work

-Long-term opportunity with growth potential

-Clear expectations and direct communication

-Exposure to business operations and decision-making

-Supportive business owners

-Opportunity to take real ownership of a critical function



How to apply : 



Please send the following to 
 with the subject line:

“Finance & Admin Assistant Application – [Your Name]”

Your cover letter answering the following (we will not proceed with applications that do not answer these questions):



1. Why are you a strong fit for this role and why does this role interest you?

2. What experience do you have with Australian bookkeeping and BAS?

3. How confident are you using Xero? Please describe your level of experience.

4. Your expected hourly rate

5. How many hours per week are you available?  And how many ideally would you like? 

6. A bit about you,  your background, goals, or anything you’d like to share with us about you as a person



Please also include:

Your CV

A screenshot of your internet speed



We look forward to your application.

title: Automation Specialist - Marketing/SaaS
description:
Who We Are

Founded in 2016 here in San Diego, Jumper Media helps local businesses get the visibility they deserve. Our mission is to deliver 10x more value than expected — with high energy, curiosity, and genuine care for the people we serve.

We specialize in helping small businesses dominate the Google Map Pack — those top 3 listings that drive calls, foot traffic, and revenue. From restaurants and med spas to plumbers, attorneys, and coffee shops — we’ve helped thousands of business owners grow their local presence and attract more customers.

It’s likely you’ve already visited at least one of our clients this month.

We’re scaling fast and we’re looking for community-minded, driven sales reps to represent Jumper Media on the ground in San Diego.





The Role: Automation Specialist - Marketing/SaaS

We are seeking a versatile Automation Specialist to focus on developing scalable automation solutions that incorporate programming, low-code platforms, chatbots, and Voice AI technologies. This role will primarily involve building and maintaining systems that reduce manual intervention and improve efficiency across our business operations.

As an Automation Specialist at Jumper Media, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining automated workflows using n8n and Retool. Your expertise will play a pivotal role in improving productivity, enhancing data accuracy, and accelerating various business processes through both automation and internal tool development.

 automation systems

-Customer IO Data Pipeline



You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities, build internal tools and dashboards in Retool, customize workflows, and ensure seamless integration between different tools and systems. This role also includes advanced automation development, lifecycle marketing automation, analytics tracking, AI-powered solutions, and internal operations tool building.





Responsibilities

-Design, configure, and customize automated workflows using Zapier, Make, and n8n to connect various apps and tools

-Build internal tools, dashboards, and admin panels using Retool

-Develop and optimize
 and lifecycle automation systems using Customer IO

-Develop and integrate analytics tracking systems for performance measurement

-Ensure smooth integration between different platforms, databases, APIs, and software applications

-Analyze existing workflows, identify bottlenecks, and recommend improvements to optimize efficiency and accuracy

-Build and deploy chatbots and AI voice agents to streamline operations

-Thoroughly test automated workflows and Retool applications to ensure they function as intended, and troubleshoot and resolve any issues

-Create comprehensive documentation of workflows and internal tools, including setup instructions and troubleshooting guides

-Monitor automated processes and internal tools, proactively address errors, and perform necessary updates and maintenance



Qualifications/Skills

-3+ years of professional experience as an Automation Specialist or similar role

-Proven expertise in Zapier, Make, n8n, and Retool

-Experience building internal tools, dashboards, or admin systems using Retool

-Strong understanding of
 automation and lifecycle marketing systems

-Experience with analytics implementation and performance tracking

-Programming knowledge and experience in low-code development environments

-Experience building chatbots and AI voice agents

-Solid understanding of API integrations, data mapping, and transformation processes

-Excellent communication skills to collaborate with both technical and non-technical tea
mbers

-Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously

-Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail



Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $2500-$3000/month



Experience:

Marketing Agency: 3 years (Required)

Python: 2 years (Required)

Langchain: 1 year (Preferred)



Language:

English (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Submit your application to 
 along with your resume and answers to the questions below:

-How many years of experience do you have working in a marketing agency environment?

-Have you built production workflows using n8n?

-Do you have at least 2 years of Python experience?

-Do you have at least 1 year of Langchain experience?

-Are you comfortable using Time Doctor to track time and projects?

-Are you comfortable working full-time remote with overlapping hours in US time zones?

title: VSL Video Creator — Direct Response Health Brand (Remote / Project-Based)
description:
We're looking for a skilled VSL (Video Sales Letter) creator to produce high-converting long-form video ads for Sinuvia a red light therapy device that treats chronic nasal congestion.

Our audience: men 50+ who've tried sprays, ENTs, and surgery with no lasting relief. They're skeptical, burned out, and scrolling past anything that looks like a typical ad. Your job is to make them stop, watch, and buy.

What you'll create:



VSLs (3–10 min) for Meta, YouTube, and landing pages

Script-to-screen execution: we provide winning hooks, angles, and scripts you bring them to life with pacing, visuals, and editing

Talking-head, B-roll, text overlay, and hybrid formats

Multiple variations per VSL for A/B testing (different hooks, CTAs, pacing)



What we need from you:



Proven experience creating VSLs or long-form direct response video ads (portfolio required)

Strong understanding of pacing, retention, and scroll-stopping editing

Ability to work with existing scripts and ad frameworks (Hormozi-style value stacking, mechanism education, proof layering)

Clean audio, professional lighting, and sharp editing no overproduced "brand film" aesthetic

Fast turnaround: first draft within 5–7 business days per project



Bonus if you:



Have experience in health/wellness DTC brands

Understand Eugene Schwartz awareness levels and funnel stages

Can suggest visual concepts that reinforce the script's emotional beats

Have access to stock footage libraries or can shoot original B-roll



Project scope:



Project-based / per-video compensation

Ongoing work available for strong performers we test aggressively and scale winners

Budget discussed per project based on complexity and deliverables



To apply:

Send 2–3 examples of VSLs or long-form video ads you've created (preferably direct response / DTC health). Include a short note on what your role was (script, edit, full production) and your per-project rate.

title: VA for Real. Estate Agent Team
description:
Virtual Assistant – Real Estate Operations & Transaction Coordinator

Orlando-Based Real Estate Team | Keller Williams Remote | Full-Time

About Us

We are a fast-growing, top-producing real estate team based in the Orlando, Florida metro area. We specialize in helping families buy, sell, and invest in Central Florida — including communities like Lake Nona, Wedgefield, and surrounding areas. Our brand is built on modern marketing, an elevated client experience, and deep community involvement. We are on track to surpass $10 million in sales volume and are now building the operations infrastructure to match our growth. We are looking for a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant who will be the backbone of our daily operations. This is not a task-taker role — this is a key operational hire who will own processes, protect deadlines, and represent our brand in every client and vendor interaction.

The Role

You will manage the full operational load of the team, with a heavy emphasis on transaction coordination, client communication, and marketing execution. In your first 4–6 months, you will learn all systems and processes end-to-end. Once fully up to speed, you will be responsible for hiring and onboarding a dedicated Transaction Coordinator to take over contract management, freeing you to focus on broader operations and marketing. This role requires someone who is highly communicative, deadline-obsessed, and takes complete ownership of their responsibilities. Missing a contract deadline or failing to follow up with a client is never acceptable here.

Key Responsibilities

Transaction Coordination

Manage all contracts from executed agreement through closing — tracking every deadline, contingency, and required document without exception

Send all required disclosures, addendums, and contract documents via DocuSign to clients, title, lenders, and agents promptly

Upload fully executed documents to the CRM and MLS in a timely manner

Maintain the transaction tracker with all deal milestones and status updates

Coordinate with title companies, lenders, and cooperating agents throughout the transaction timeline

Send weekly seller updates using established
 templates

Prepare and send MLS modifications, price reductions, open house additions, and cancellations

Send Friday transaction summary
s with all contract updates

Create and maintain SOPs for all transaction workflows

Onboard new buyers and sellers — send agreements, onboarding
s, and add to the appropriate
 campaigns

Add all new clients to the Client Experience Checklist and keep it current throughout the transaction

Client Communication & CRM Management

Respond to all client, vendor, and agent communications promptly — same day is the standard

Monitor and manage the team inbox; flag urgent items and handle routine correspondence

Follow up with clients on unsigned documents, missing items, and scheduled appointments

Manage
 SmartPlan campaigns for buyer leads, seller leads, under contract, closed, and FSBO sequences

Add and tag all leads in the CRM with proper categories

Send onboarding, under contract, and closing
s using established templates

Manage DocuSign templates — create and maintain pre-filled agreements

Follow up with orphan buyers, FSBOs, expired listings, and ad leads

Communicate clearly and professionally — fluent English is mandatory for this role

Systems & CRM Administration

Maintain KW Command and GoHighLevel: add contacts, manage pipelines, update tags, and keep the Client Experience Checklist current

Maintain Airtable for transaction tracking, social media scheduling, and database management

Update the business tracker with closings, listings, and pipeline data

Manage the past client database — run regular touchpoint reports and ensure data accuracy

Organize and maintain Google Drive — folders, templates, and file naming conventions

Keep the operations manual (Trello, Google Docs) current and organized

Marketing & Social Media

Schedule and publish social media content across Instagram,
, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

Coordinate with the videographer via review platforms — add titles, manage uploads, and scheduling workflow

Create Canva graphics, lead magnets, flyers, and presentations using brand guidelines

Draft social media captions in a natural, human brand voice (not AI-sounding)

Add proper hashtags and spacing for each platform; tag collaborators as appropriate

Design and post open house flyers, price improvement announcements, under contract reels, and sold reels

Manage
 groups and community pages — post content and manage vendor/event posts

Create and manage event listings; add events to the team calendar with reminders

Create and manage paid
/Instagram ad campaigns (small budget campaigns)

Create lead magnets — buyer guides, seller guides, relocation guides, neighborhood guides, and wealth-building content

Update and maintain all agent profiles on third-party real estate platforms

Lead Magnets, Campaigns & Automations

Create and maintain
 sequences for all lead types: buyers, sellers, FSBOs, expired listings, new construction, under contract, closed, and referral

Build and manage automations for lead magnets, appointment confirmations, and review requests

Create and manage online forms for events, open houses, showings, vendor applications, and lead capture

Manage seasonal client touch campaigns (pop-bys, holiday events, community events)

Events & Community

Coordinate community and client events end-to-end: flyers, RSVPs, invites, volunteer forms, logistics, post-event thank yous and feedback
s

Manage event signups and export attendee lists

Post events and promote on relevant >
munity groups

Send calendar invites and reminders to vendors and sponsors

Create and update SOPs for recurring annual events

Administrative & Operations

Manage the team calendar — appointments, events, reminders, and deadlines

Monitor daily for completed DocuSigns that need uploading to the CRM

Handle admin hiring pipeline communications as directed

Keep the operations manual updated with new SOPs and processes

Research and recommend tools and platforms as needed

Manage integrations between platforms (Zapier, etc.)

Create video SOPs by screen recording processes for the training library

Perform mail merges for neighborhood mailers and past client campaigns



Required Qualifications

Fluent in English — spoken and written (non-negotiable; you will communicate directly with clients, agents, vendors, and title companies)

Proficient in Canva — able to create professional graphics using brand guidelines

Comfortable working in a Robust CRM, Airtable, Google Workspace, DocuSign, Trello, and Stellar MLS

Strong understanding of Instagram,
, TikTok, and YouTube

Excellent written communication — you write like a human, not a robot

Extremely organized with a strong ability to prioritize and manage multiple deadlines simultaneously

Self-directed — you don't wait to be told twice; you see what needs to be done and you do it

Responsive during business hours

Knows how to use AI platforms like chatgpt, claude and other technology that is current in the market.

You know how to edit videos using capcut or any similar software.

Preferred Qualifications

Bilingual in English and Spanish

Experience with real estate transaction management — you understand contract timelines, earnest money deadlines, inspection periods, and closing logistics

Experience building GoHighLevel automations and workflows

Experience running paid
/Instagram ad campaigns

Familiarity with Zapier, Eventbrite, JotForm, Gamma.app, or Beacons.ai





How to Apply

Read these instructions carefully. Following them exactly is the first test of whether you are the right fit for this role.

Subject line must read exactly: I Read Every Word – VA + TC [Your Name] (Applications with any other subject line will be automatically disqualified — no exceptions)

In the body of your
, include the following — in this exact order:

A 2–3 sentence introduction about yourself (do NOT copy and paste a generic cover letter)

Your top 3 relevant experiences or accomplishments that make you the right fit for this specific role

Your answer to this question: "Describe a time you managed a tight deadline. What was the situation and what did you do?"

Your availability (time zone, hours per week, start date)

Attach your resume.

Include a link to a 2–3 minute video introduction (Loom, YouTube unlisted, or Google Drive link) telling us who you are and why you want this role and why you think you would excel in this role. Applications without a video will not be reviewed.

title: Social Sales Executive
description:
Job Title: Strategic Growth & Community Evangelist

Duration: 90-Day Sprint



Compensation: $10,000 AUD equivalent (Paid in $ZIRC) (Token by NYBlue)



Vesting: Full redemption available at the conclusion of the 90-day term.



The Mission

We are launching a disruptive financial instrument designed to redefine market standards. We are looking for a tactical team of Growth Specialists to build organic momentum, educate the market, and drive high-value adoption through strategic networking and community engagement.



Core Responsibilities

Market Sentiment Engineering: Actively participate in key financial forums, social channels, and niche communities to highlight the utility and advantages of our product.



High-Value Targeting: Identify and engage "Whales" or sophisticated investors, providing them with bespoke insights and white-glove introductions to our ecosystem.



Narrative Building: Work with the internal team to refine and spread a compelling value proposition that cuts through the noise of the current market.



Strategic Outreach: Use social engineering and networking skills to establish our product as a "must-have" within influential circles.



The Ideal Candidate

The Connector: You have a "silver tongue" and the ability to build rapport quickly with both retail users and high-net-worth individuals.



The Strategist: You understand market psychology and know how to seed ideas that grow into trends.



Crypto-Fluent: You have a deep understanding of tokenomics and the mechanics of modern financial instruments.



Resilient: You thrive in fast-paced, high-reward environments and can operate autonomously to hit targets.



Why Join Us?

This isn't just a job; it’s a chance to be on the ground floor of a major financial shift. You’ll be part of an elite "special ops" growth team with a payout structured to reward the success of the very instrument you are helping to build.

description:

We’re a UK-based recruitment agency specialising in Automotive Sales Executives.



We’re looking for a confident, organised LinkedIn Outreach & Appointment Setter to help us start conversations with dealership sales professionals across the UK and book qualified calls into our calendar.

Identifying Automotive Sales Executives on LinkedIn (UK-based)



Sending connection requests and personalised messages



Following up consistently with non-responders



Building rapport and generating interest in potential career opportunities



Asking light qualification questions (location, experience, openness to move)



Booking interested candidates into our calendar



Keeping accurate records of conversations and progress



Your focus is quality conversations and booked calls — not just sending mass messages.



What We’re Looking For



Strong written English and clear communication



Experience with LinkedIn outreach or lead generation



Confident following up multiple times without being pushy



Organised and consistent with tracking conversations



Comfortable working independently



Reliable internet connection



Recruitment experience is helpful but not essential.

What Success Looks Like



Candidates respond and engage in conversation



People say they’re open to hearing about the right opportunity



Qualified candidates are booked into our calendar



Outreach is consistent and organised

Hours & Pay



2-3 hours per day



Tuesday to Friday



Flexible schedule (UK time overlap preferred)



Competitive hourly rate DOE

Long-term opportunity for the right person





To Apply

title: Remote Primary Care Nurse (RN)
description:
About Mulberry Health



Mulberry Health is a forward-thinking healthcare provider dedicated to delivering exceptional primary care services remotely. We are committed to leveraging technology to provide accessible, high-quality care to our patients. We are expanding our team and looking for three dedicated and skilled nurses from the Philippines to join us in our mission.



Job Summary



We are seeking experienced and compassionate Remote Primary Care Nurses to provide comprehensive virtual nursing care and back-office support. The ideal candidates will be responsible for a combination of clinical and administrative tasks, ensuring our patients receive the best possible care and our operations run smoothly. This is a full-time, remote position for candidates based in the Philippines.



Key Responsibilities



Primary Care Nursing (70%):

- Conduct virtual patient consultations via phone and video to assess patient conditions, provide nursing care, and offer patient education.

- Monitor and document patient vital signs, symptoms, and health progress in the EMR system.

- Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of physicians, specialists, and other healthcare professionals to coordinate patient care.

- Develop and implement individualized patient care plans.

- Assist patients with medication management and adherence.



MA Back-Office Responsibilities (30%):

- Manage patient appointments, including scheduling, rescheduling, and sending reminders.

- Handle administrative tasks such as processing medical billing, managing patient records, and ensuring data accuracy.

- Transcribe physician's notes and update patient charts in the EMR system.

- Assist with prior authorizations and other insurance-related tasks.



Required Qualifications:

- Active and unrestricted Registered Nurse (RN) license in the Philippines (PRC License).

- Minimum of 2 years of clinical experience in a hospital or primary care setting.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

- Reliable high-speed internet connection (minimum 150 Mbps) and a quiet, professional home office setup.

- Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently.

- Must be available Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm Arizona time (MST/MDT).



Preferred Qualifications:

- Previous experience in a remote nursing or telehealth role.

- Proficiency with EMR/EHR systems, with a strong preference for eClinicalWorks (ECW). Experience with Epic, Athena, or similar platforms is also valued.

- US Registered Nurse (USRN) license is a strong advantage but not required.

- BLS and/or ACLS certifications are highly desirable.



Compensation and Benefits:

- Competitive hourly rate: $5.00 - $8.00 USD per hour (commensurate with experience)

- 15 days paid time off (PTO) annually

- 10 paid US holidays

- Opportunities for ongoing training and career advancement



To Apply:

Please send your resume (PDF) and a short 1-2 minute video introduction to 
 with the subject line: "Application for Remote Primary Care Nurse - [Your Name]"

title: Accounting Specialist – Trucking & Logistics
description:
Position Overview



We are seeking a detail-oriented Accounting Specialist with experience in the trucking and logistics industry. The ideal candidate understands factoring, driver settlements, fuel deductions, lease fees, dispatch fees, and QuickBooks Online.



This role is critical to maintaining accurate financial records, managing driver payments, and ensuring compliance with DOT and FMCSA requirements.



Key Responsibilities



• Process daily driver settlements (lease operators & owner-operators)

• Calculate and deduct:



Lease fees



Factoring fees



Dispatch fees



Fuel & diesel advances



Insurance deductions

• Manage factoring submissions (Truckstop / Denim preferred)

• Reconcile ACH payments & Zelle transfers

• Maintain QuickBooks Online (QBO) accuracy

• Generate 1099-NEC forms

• Monitor negative balances

• Track cargo claims deductions

• Assist with payroll & contractor payments

• Communicate with brokers & factoring companies



Requirements



? Experience in trucking accounting (REQUIRED)

? Strong knowledge of QuickBooks Online

? Understanding of factoring (2.99%, 5%, etc.)

? Familiar with fuel cards (Pilot, EFS, etc.)

? Strong math & reconciliation skills

? Ability to manage high-volume settlements (50+ drivers preferred)

? Bilingual (English/Spanish preferred)

title: YouTube Video Editor + Social Media Repurposing (Part-Time, Detail-Focused)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

I run Block Out the Noise, content for teens and young adults who want help with anxiety, self-doubt, and overthinking. I am hiring a part-time YouTube video editor who can also repurpose videos into short-form content and help schedule posts.



This is a long-term role for someone who wants to grow with me. Strong performance leads to more work and more responsibility over time.



EDITING STYLE I WANT

I want YouTube editing similar to Alexa Saarenoja’s pacing and style.

Reference:





HOURS

About 6 hours per week.

Goal: 2 YouTube videos per week.

Editing time expectation: 2 to 3 hours per video, depending on length and complexity.



TOP PRIORITY

Video editing is the main priority. Content is king. I need someone who takes my videos to the next level.



WHAT YOU WILL DO



YouTube video editing (main focus)

• Tighten pacing, remove long pauses, cut repetition

• Clean audio and smooth cuts

• Add on-screen text and b-roll where it improves clarity and retention

• Deliver a final, polished edit ready for upload



YouTube publishing

• Upload in YouTube Studio

• Add title, description, tags, chapters, and timestamps

• Add end screens and cards

• Schedule the video after I approve



Repurposing for short-form

• Create short clips from each YouTube video for:

• Instagram

• TikTok

•

• Provide captions or on-screen text where needed



Scheduling in Metricool

• Schedule posts for the week based on the video content

• Coordinate with me on the posting plan



DETAILS MATTER HERE

I need someone who double-checks their work before sending it to me.

• Catch typos, caption mistakes, timing issues, audio pops, and formatting errors

• Follow a checklist so I am not spending time catching things you can catch



TOOLS

• Riverside (source recordings)

• Adobe Premiere or Davinci Resolve (for editing)

• YouTube Studio (upload and scheduling)

• Metricool (social scheduling)



APPROVAL PROCESS

Nothing goes live until I approve:

• Final YouTube title

• Final thumbnail

• First line of the YouTube description

• Any major format changes



TO APPLY

Please include:

- 2 to 4 links or downloads to YouTube videos you edited

- Your weekly availability 

- The word DETAILS in the first line of your application

title: Marketing Specialist & Systems Architect
description:
Executive Summary



We are seeking a rare hybrid talent: a Marketing Specialist & Systems Architect who possesses the strategic vision of a brand manager and the technical execution skills of a digital automator. You will not only be responsible for launching and managing multi-channel campaigns (digital and print) but will also be tasked with building the "machine" behind the marketing—optimizing websites for SEO, managing CRM workflows in GoHighLevel, and ensuring that automation is the answer to every scaling challenge.

Key Responsibilities



Strategic Implementation:

Design and execute comprehensive social media and print campaigns that align with brand identity and ROI goals. You will bridge the gap between high-level strategy and daily execution.



Full-Stack Web & SEO:

Take complete ownership of website management, ensuring all digital properties are high-performing, secure, and aggressively optimized for search engines to drive organic growth.



Automation & Systems:

Implement and manage complex workflows within GoHighLevel and other scheduling platforms. You will be expected to find efficiencies in every process to reduce manual overhead.



AI Integration:

Leverage AI as a force multiplier for content ideation, data analysis, and efficiency without sacrificing the "human touch" or brand authenticity.



Multi-Channel Marketing:

Seamlessly pivot between digital ad spend, social media engagement, and traditional print marketing materials to create a cohesive brand experience.

Technical & Professional Requirements

Skill Category Requirement

Marketing Mastery 3-5 years in Digital & Print marketing with a portfolio of successful social media campaigns.

Systems & CRM Professional proficiency in GoHighLevel (funnels, workflows, snapshots) and content schedulers.

Web & SEO Proven ability to fully manage CMS platforms (WordPress/Wix/GHL) and execute technical SEO audits.

Automation Mindset Demonstrated experience building automated lead-gen or nurture sequences.

The "Edge" (Coding) Basic to intermediate knowledge of HTML, CSS, or JavaScript to customize web elements and integrations.

AI Literacy Ability to use AI for efficiency while maintaining high-quality, non-generic output.

Why This Role is Unique



We aren't looking for a "virtual assistant" to simply check off tasks. We are looking for a specialist who understands that automation is the key to scale. You will have the autonomy to build and refine our marketing tech stack. You will be the engine that allows our brands to show up everywhere, efficiently, while maintaining the tactical flexibility of a boutique operation.

Candidate Profile



    The Growth Architect: You don't just "post" to social media; you build systems that convert followers into leads.



    The Technical Creative: You are as comfortable looking at a line of code or an SEO dashboard as you are designing a brand-aligned print flyer.



    The AI-Augmented Pro: You use AI to work 10x faster, but you have the discernment to know when a human eye is non-negotiable.



Work Environment



This is a fully virtual position offering flexibility to work from anywhere while maintaining collaborative relationships with tea
mbers and clients across various time zones. This is initially a contract role with a strong path toward permanent placement for a high-performer who proves their value through systems and results.

Application Process



To be considered for this position, please visit: 



    Note: Due to our strict HR Policy, applications will not be considered if they are not received through the official careers site linked above.



This position requires candidates to successfully complete our comprehensive evaluation process, which includes technical assessments and multiple interview stages to ensure the best fit for both the role and our organizational culture.

title: SEO Manager for Real Estate Investment Company
description:
SEO Manager

Company: Tampa Fast Homebuyer

Websites: 
 and 

Location: Tampa Bay, FL

Employment Type: Full Time or Part Time or Contract



About Us

We are a local Tampa Bay real estate investment firm. We buy houses for cash in Tampa, St Petersburg, Clearwater, Largo, Seminole, and surrounding areas. We focus on motivated sellers, inherited properties, storm damaged homes, foreclosure situations, and off market opportunities. We are BBB accredited with an A plus rating and have been operating since 2016.



Position Overview

You will own the entire SEO strategy for both websites. Your goal is simple. Increase qualified seller leads. Improve rankings for high intent keywords. Dominate local search in Tampa Bay and Pinellas County. You will drive traffic that converts into inbound calls and form submissions from motivated homeowners.



Key Responsibilities



SEO Strategy and Planning

• Build and execute a comprehensive SEO strategy for both domains

• Perform advanced keyword research focused on seller intent such as sell my house fast Tampa, cash home buyers St Petersburg, we buy houses Clearwater

• Create content clusters by city and neighborhood

• Develop topical authority around foreclosure, probate, divorce, storm damage, inherited homes



On Page SEO

• Optimize title tags, meta descriptions, headers, schema markup

• Improve internal linking structure across both sites

• Ensure every city page targets a primary and secondary keyword

• Optimize Google Business Profile pages for Tampa and St Petersburg

• Implement FAQ schema for AEO and AI search visibility



Technical SEO

• Conduct regular technical audits

• Improve site speed and Core Web Vitals

• Fix crawl errors, indexing issues, and duplicate content

• Manage XML sitemaps and robots.txt

• Implement structured data for local business and reviews



Content Development

• Create SEO focused blog posts for Tampa and St Petersburg housing market trends

• Develop long form pillar pages for each major city in Hillsborough and Pinellas County

• Coordinate with writers and editors

• Refresh and update older articles to improve rankings

• Ensure all content is optimized for AI searchable queries



Local SEO

• Optimize Google Business Profiles

• Build and manage local citations

• Improve NAP consistency across directories

• Develop location pages for neighborhoods such as Seminole Heights, Westchase, Largo, Clearwater, Pinellas Park

• Implement review generation strategy



Link Building

• Develop white hat backlink strategy

• Build local authority links

• Secure guest posts and local PR placements

• Monitor backlink profile and remove toxic links



Analytics and Reporting

• Track rankings for priority keywords

• Monitor traffic, conversions, and cost per lead

• Set up and manage Google Analytics and Google Search Console

• Provide monthly performance reports

• Tie SEO performance to actual seller contracts and revenue



Required Qualifications

• 3 plus years experience in SEO

• Proven track record ranking local service businesses

• Strong understanding of local SEO and Google Business Profile optimization

• Experience with Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, or similar tools

• Ability to interpret data and turn it into action

• Strong copywriting and conversion optimization skills



Preferred Qualifications

• Experience in real estate or motivated seller marketing

• Knowledge of Carrot websites

• Familiarity with Hillsborough County and Pinellas County markets

• Understanding of schema and structured data



Performance Metrics

You will be measured on:

• Increase in organic traffic

• Growth in first page rankings

• Number of inbound seller leads

• Cost per acquisition from organic search

• Growth in Google Business Profile calls and direction requests



Compensation

Competitive base salary or monthly retainer plus performance bonus tied to lead volume and closed deals.



How to Apply

Send resume, case studies, and ranking examples for local businesses. Include data that shows traffic growth, keyword improvements, and lead generation results.



If you are data driven, competitive, and want to dominate the Tampa Bay real estate SEO market, this role is for you.

 Ads or Google Ads

o The probation period may be shortened if you demonstrate fast work adaptation and receive an excellent evaluation. (This has occurred in multiple past cases.)

o Performance & Total Compensation Structure:

Upon regularization, employees receive a guaranteed 13th Month Pay and at least one annual performance bonus equivalent to one month’s base salary during peak sales seasons. Additional bonuses may be granted based on company performance. When annualized, the total compensation is equivalent to approximately USD 350–380 per month.

o Continued employment and salary maintenance are subject to overall performance evaluation.

o If performance does not meet expectations, adjustments may be made in accordance with company standards.

• Additional Compensation:

o Performance-based incentives may be provided based on work attitude, responsibility, consistency, and overall contribution.



• After Regularization:

o Annual contract renewal is standard

- Salary adjustments may be made based on performance, teamwork, and overall evaluation.

o If overall performance—including work capability, teamwork, reliability, and internal evaluations—is considered outstanding, salary increases may be granted within a shorter period. (This has occurred in multiple past cases.)

o Exceptional performance may also lead to early promotions or salary increases prior to the annual review.



[Perks & Benefits]

2. Performance-Based Incentives

- Additional incentives may be provided during high-performance sales periods

(Example: major comeback seasons for artists such as BTS or Stray Kids)

Just Fill out 10 Simple Questions through Google Form

s or

title: Revenue Manager
description:
Revenue Manager – Short-Term Rental Portfolio

Full-Time | Remote | Structured Growth Role



We are building a performance-driven revenue management program under HostOp, serving multi-unit short-term rental operators (20–100+ listings across multiple markets).



We are hiring a highly analytical Revenue Manager to oversee pricing execution, reporting, and performance tracking across multiple portfolios.



This is a data-driven role. Not a general VA position.



***************



Core Responsibilities



* Execute dynamic pricing adjustments inside PriceLabs

* Monitor booking pace, occupancy, ADR, and RevPAR trends

* Analyze underperforming listings and adjust strategy

* Segment portfolios by market and optimize independently

* Pull and reconcile monthly revenue reports from Hostaway

* Maintain structured dashboards (Notion + reporting systems)

* Prepare monthly billing calculations (2.5% revenue model)

* Provide structured Slack performance updates to clients

* Identify risks and opportunities proactively



***************



Required Experience



* 2+ years working in STR revenue management

* Strong experience using PriceLabs (required)

* Experience using Hostaway or similar PMS (required)

* Strong understanding of ADR, Occupancy, RevPAR

* Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills

* Strong written English communication

* Comfortable working with structured systems



Bonus:

* OTA background (Airbnb / 
)

* Multi-market portfolio experience



***************



Work Structure



* Full-time remote

* Slack-based communication

* Structured weekly cadence

* No reactive daily firefighting

* Performance-based growth path



***************



Compensation



Month 1: $1,200 USD Monthly (structured trial)

After 90 days: $1,500 USD Monthly upon strong execution and independent portfolio ownership



Clear path to managing multiple portfolios independently.



***************



To Apply



Please answer:

1. How many STR listings have you managed pricing for?

2. What pricing tools have you used? (PriceLabs required)

Applications without detailed answers will not be reviewed.

Have experience in health, fitness, beauty, or women’s products

Understand Meta ad traffic and advertorial-to-checkout flows

Have written post-purchase upsell sequences



???? Why Join Skinnify?

???? Work Fully Remote – Flexible location and schedule

???? Hyper-Growth Brand – Real scale, real traffic, real impact

???? High Ownership Role – Your copy directly affects revenue

???? Performance-Focused Team – Decisions based on data, not opinions

???? Learn & Grow Fast – Work with experienced media buyers and creatives

? Loved by the team: 5/5 rating on Glassdoor





???????? The Skinnify Story

Skinnify was founded to help busy women get fitter without going to the gym.

Our first product — resistance band leggings — turned everyday movement into exercise. Today, we’re building an entire ecosystem of innovative fitness wear.



???? Skinnify’s Core Values

???? Innovation – We rethink what fitness clothing can do

???? Effectiveness – Every product and funnel must perform

???? Accessibility – Fitness for busy, real people

???? Fun – Work should feel energizing, not draining

? Quality – High standards in everything we build

title: Video Editor (Social Media)
description:

Job type: Full Time

Location: Fully Remote

Salary: starts at $1100, depending on experience



This role is NOT traditional editing-heavy.

We want someone who knows how to create, remix, and produce short-form content using modern AI video tools.

If you don’t actively use AI video platforms, this role is not for you.

Google VEO 3

Pika Labs

Kaiber

Synthesia

HeyGen

Descript

CapCut AI

-Strong understanding of TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Shorts format





What You’ll Do

*Create short-form AI-generated videos

*Turn scripts into finished videos using AI tools

*Repurpose podcasts or long-form content into short clips

*Test new AI video tools regularly

*Deliver videos ready to post



How to Apply:

-Resume

-Portfolio (AI videos only)

-1–2 minute Loom explaining:



Applications without AI portfolio samples will be ignored.

title: Ebay Account Manager
description:
Job Title: eBay Account Manager (Remote – Philippines)



About EVORETRO:

EVORETRO is a fast-growing international brand specializing in collectible protection and display accessories (trading cards, graded cards, Funko, Hot Wheels, miniatures, etc.).



We sell globally through:



•Shopify

•Amazon

•eBay

•Distributors & trade shows



We are scaling aggressively and looking for a detail-oriented, data-driven eBay expert to manage and grow our eBay account.



Role Overview:

The eBay Account Manager will execute strategies, manage daily operations, and optimize our eBay store for growth.

This is not just a listing role—you will focus on sales performance, customer satisfaction, and operational excellence.



Key Responsibilities:



1. eBay Account Management

•Maintain and optimize product listings (titles, SEO, item specifics)

•Optimize images and descriptions

•Sync inventory with Shopify

•Monitor pricing and competitor activity



2. Sales & Growth Support

•Drive monthly revenue growth

•Monitor conversion rates and identify high-performing SKUs

•Suggest promotions and sales strategies



3. eBay Ads (Promoted Listings)

•Launch and manage ad campaigns

•Track ad performance, ROAS, and spend

•Test and optimize ad strategies



4. Operational Performance

•Ensure on-time shipping and reduce cancellations

•Coordinate with 3PL partners (Tandem)

•Maintain Top Rated Seller standards and minimize defects



5. Customer Support

•Respond to buyer messages promptly

•Resolve disputes and manage returns professionally

•Maintain positive feedback ?99%



6. Reporting & Metrics

•Track and report KPIs weekly (revenue, conversion, traffic, ads, defects)

•Contribute to monthly growth planning



Success Metrics / KPIs:

•Increase monthly sales by 10–20%

•Maintain defect rate ?0.5%

•Maintain Top Rated Seller status

•Improve conversion rate consistently

•Keep positive feedback ?99%



 Ideal Candidate:

•2+ years managing an eBay account

•Experience with Promoted Listings and eBay SEO

•Data-driven and detail-oriented

•Fluent in English (written & spoken)

•Organized, proactive, and execution-focused

•Experience with Shopify or inventory sync tools is a plus



Why Join EVORETRO:

•Fast-growing international brand

•Exposure to global collectors market

•Direct collaboration with CEO

•Opportunity to specialize in marketplace growth

•Long-term career growth potential



???? How to Apply:

Send the following:

•Resume

•Example of an eBay store you managed

•Monthly revenue you helped generate

•Screenshot of performance metrics

•Short video introduction (2–3 minutes)

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Role: Senior Accountant

Salary: $1500 (negotiable)

Remote (Philippines-based) | Full-time (40 hours/week) | U.S. PST hours or significant overlap



ABOUT THE ROLE

A high growth U.S.-based F&B franchise is seeking a Senior Accountant to work with the CFO & VP of Finance take ownership of recurring finance operations, reporting, and data workflows across its 200+ franchise business. This role is designed to remove manual, repeatable finance work from senior leaders and introduce more consistency, structure, and scalability into reporting and finance processes.



What You’ll Do:

- Manage end-to-end financial reporting and operations for a U.S.-based F&B franchise, including preparing and consolidating Excel reports from multiple systems, validating data, and overseeing 200+ franchisee P&Ls.

- Handle finance operations, royalty fee workflows, and administrative tasks with minimal supervision.

- Drive process improvements, implement and optimize tools like QuickBooks, Avalara, and Concur, and document workflows to streamline recurring finance tasks.



Requirements:

- 2+ years of experience with accounting, finance, banking, or bookkeeping (or BPO experience supporting those industries)

- 2+ years experience in financial reporting, financial operations, and FP&A roles (U.S. companies preferred)

- Expert Excel proficiency (pivot tables, lookups, formulas, data cleaning/merging, data validation)

- Solid understanding of financial statements, especially P&Ls

- Strong proficiency in English (at least C1 level), with excellent written communication skills

- Self-starter with creating net-new processes and automations

- Intense attention to detail

- Exceptionally organized, proactive, and capable of driving tasks to completion with minimal supervision

- Bachelor Degree or higher (summa, magna or cum laude and/or Academic Scholar from a reputable college preferred)



Preferred:

- Previous experience working with U.S. restaurant / F&B operators

- Familiarity with sales tax software (ideally Avalara)

- Familiarity with Quickbooks

- Curiosity about AI (e.g. ChatGPT, Claude) and desire to experiment with AI in day-to-day work

- Licensed CPA



To apply, send your resume and a short introduction
 to: 

Subject: Your Name – Applicant for Senior Accountant

Example: Maria Santos – Applicant for Senior Accountant

Please submit your application to the
. DMs are not monitored.

title: Paralegal
description:
Position: Paralegal

Full-Time, Remote, PST

Salary: $6/hr



About the Company:

We are a fast-growing food and wellness company focused on delivering high-quality culinary experiences. We value operational excellence, compliance, and efficiency across all areas of the business.



Role Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented, proactive Paralegal to support our legal and compliance functions. The ideal candidate will assist with contract management, regulatory research, and general legal support, helping the company navigate complex legal and operational requirements.



Key Responsibilities:

- Draft, review, and organize contracts, NDAs, and other legal documents.

- Conduct legal research and provide summaries to support decision-making.

- Assist with compliance monitoring, ensuring adherence to relevant regulations and company policies.

- Maintain organized records of contracts, agreements, and legal correspondence.

- Support internal teams with legal inquiries and documentation preparation.

- Coordinate with external counsel as needed for specialized matters.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Law, Paralegal Studies, or related field.

- Minimum 2 years of experience as a paralegal or in a legal support role.

- Strong understanding of contract law, corporate compliance, and regulatory frameworks.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

- Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and document management systems.



Preferred Skills:

- Experience in the food, hospitality, or wellness industry.

- Familiarity with remote work tools and cloud-based document management.

- Ability to anticipate legal needs and provide practical, actionable support.



To apply, send your resume and a short introduction
 to: 

Subject: Your Name – Applicant for (Role)

Example: Maria Santos – Applicant for Paralegal

Please submit your application to the
. DMs are not monitored.

title: Appointment Setter
description:
Title: Appointment Setter

Hours: Full-time | Time Zone: U.S. Business Hours

Pay: Base $1,200 + per-meeting commission (OTE)



About the Role

We’re a U.S.-based legal-marketing company helping law firms grow through lead generation. As a BDR / Appointment Setter, you’ll make outbound calls to law-firm decision-makers, introduce our software, and book discovery meetings for our sales team. We provide scripts and leads—but top performers improve the process, capture insights, and drive results. First 2 months pay full OTE; after that, base + commission.



Who You Are:

- Confident, persuasive, and resilient with no fear of rejection

- Excellent spoken English (minimal accent)

- Results-driven and self-motivated

- Comfortable making high-volume outbound calls and managing your pipeline

- Tech-savvy; quick to learn CRMs and dialers (Zoho, Vonage, etc.)



What You’ll Do:

- Call law-firm prospects daily to secure qualified appointments

- Tailor messaging, handle objections, and log activity in CRM

- Maintain high-volume activity (hundreds of calls weekly)

- Book 5+ meetings/week during ramp; 10/week = top performer

- Collaborate with the team to improve scripts, leads, and outreach strategy



Requirements:

- 1+ years in outbound sales, BDR/SDR, or appointment-setting roles (U.S. client experience preferred)

- Proven track record hitting meeting or sales targets

- Strong phone presence and professional communication

- Comfortable using CRMs, dialers, and tracking performance

- Reliable internet and quiet remote workspace



Preferred:

- Experience calling law firms or professional-services companies

- BDR/SDR experience in high-volume outbound environments

- Sales experience in lead generation, marketing, or SaaS targeting U.S. markets



Why Join Us:

If you’re ambitious, coachable, and motivated by measurable goals, you’ll thrive here. Build your skills, grow your career, and help law firms succeed—all from your home office.



To apply, send your resume and a short introduction
 to: 

Subject: Your Name – Applicant for Appointment Setter

Example: Maria Santos – Applicant for Appointment Setter

Please submit your application to the
. DMs are not monitored.
